*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: .NET/Optimizely Developer
description:
**.NET Developers & Architects/Optimizely Developers - Gothenburg & Stockholm - SWEDISH SPEAKING** 




  





**Please Note:** 
 This is a permanent role. This role is for
 **Swedish residents only** 
 . This role does not offer Sponsorship.
 **You must have the right to work in Sweden with no restrictions** 
 . Some of our roles
 *may* 
 be subject to successful background/security checks.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As a developer on our team, you'll take an active role in crafting and evolving digital solutions using Optimizely. You’ll collaborate within a cross-functional team to build high-quality, accessible, and secure platforms for a variety of forward-thinking organizations.
 



  





 Your day-to-day will involve working closely with clients, project managers, and UX designers, from initial discovery and architecture to hands-on development and long-term improvements. We follow agile methodologies and place a strong emphasis on clean code, open collaboration, and ongoing learning.
 



  





 Around 80% of their clients are in the public sector, such as municipalities and government agencies. They work with authentic and mission-driven organizations.
 



  





**\*\*If you do not have Optimizely experience, however, are proficient within .NET, then you will still be considered for this role\*\*** 




  





**We think you bring:** 



* Around 7 + years of experience working with Optimizely CMS, its broader suite of tools, and the .NET ecosystem
* Solid knowledge of C# and experience integrating with external APIs and systems
* Frontend skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, ideally with frameworks like React or Next.js
* A mindset where accessibility and security are considered fundamental, not optional
* An interest in guiding technical direction and supporting the growth of less experienced developers
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, especially Optimizely DXP or Microsoft Azure
* A consultative attitude and genuine curiosity about understanding client challenges



  





**What they offer:** 



* A tight-knit, experienced team that values collaboration and knowledge sharing
* The chance to work with recognizable brands and impactful projects in both public and private sectors
* Access to training and certification opportunities within Optimizely and related technologies
* A purpose-driven culture where learning is encouraged, successes are shared, and the workday isn’t just about work.



  





 This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.
 



  





**Twitter:** 
 @\_TenthRevolution
 



**LinkedIn:** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarah-king-624956160/
 



**Email:** 
 s.king@tenthrevolution.com
 



**Phone:** 
 +46 8 502 425 40

title: Senior Back End Developer
description:
Our client is one of Sweden’s fastest-growing gaming technology companies, powering B2B platforms for online operators worldwide.
 



  





 They are now entering a major growth phase and building a new team focused on anti-fraud, community services, and next-gen player experiences.
 



  





 This is a chance to join a small, high-impact engineering group at a formative stage; shipping fast, owning big decisions, and shaping how new products are built.
 



  





 The team optimises for
 **quality, rapid iteration, and short feedback loops** 
 and has full
 **end-to-end ownership** 
 , strong engineering autonomy, and a culture centred on experimentation, monitoring, and continuous improvement.
 



  





 If you want to avoid process paralysis, influence core tech choices, and build things that matter, continue.
 



  





**You will** 



* **Own products end-to-end:** 
 design, build, test, deploy, and monitor in production.
* Work with
 **large-scale, high-availability systems** 
 moving millions of events per minute.
* Move fast: build, iterate, release
 **multiple times a day** 
 with automated deployment.
* Help shape team culture, engineering practices, and technical direction.
* Design and evolve system architecture with hands-on coding (we are not looking for PowerPoint Architecture).
* Mentor teammates and collaborate closely with stakeholders across the business.
* Learn fast through experimentation; success, failure, and everything in between.



  





**Team Culture** 



* Small, tight-knit team early in its journey
* Real ownership and autonomy
* Low process, zero meetings, so you can
 **keep building**
* A chance to shape culture, tooling, and ways of working
* A fast, sometimes messy, but always exciting environment with driven engineers



  





**We need** 



* A broad generalist with experience setting up infrastructure and applications to handle enormous amounts of data
* Strong experience across multiple backend languages, ideally
 **Go** 
 ,
 **TypeScript** 
 ,
 **Node.js**
* Solid grounding in both
 **SQL and NoSQL databases**
* Experience with
 **serverless** 
 and
 **self-managed cloud services**
* Background with event or streaming tech (
 **Kafka, RabbitMQ, Kinesis, Flink** 
 )
* Exposure to DevOps practices and deploying scalable systems in
 **AWS**
* Experience with
 **high-throughput, high-transaction environments**
* A hands-on builder who loves solving real problems, not an architect who stopped coding



  





 If you are a senior engineer who thrives in autonomy, loves fast iteration, and wants to build new products from scratch with talented peers, this is the place to make a huge impact.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**About Enity Bank Group** 




 Enity is a challenger in the Nordic mortgage market, choosing to see the potential in people. Through inclusive, yet sustainable and responsible mortgage lending, we play an important role in supporting those who are often excluded by traditional banks.
 



  





 Since 2005, we have enabled financial empowerment for our customers, providing them access to the housing market or opportunities to get back on track through remortgage as well as offering high-yield savings accounts.
 



  





 Our brand portfolio includes Bluestep Bank, Bank2, and 60plusbanken. Together they serve customers across Sweden, Norway, and Finland, joined in a dedication to make banking simple, forward-looking, and accessible for more people.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We’re looking for a senior developer with a strong backend profile to help us modernize banking technology and create seamless digital experiences for our customers. If you enjoy solving complex problems and working with modern tech stacks, this is the role for you!
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As part of our cross-functional team, you’ll design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable applications for core banking. A key part of the role is modernizing legacy systems and transitioning them into a cloud-based, microservice-oriented architecture. You’ll collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers to continuously improve our platforms and deliver high-quality user experiences.
 



  





**Tech stack** 




 Our tech stack includes
 


* .NET Core and C# for backend development
* SQL and stored procedures for data management
* RabbitMQ, messaging patterns, and REST APIs for integration and communication
* Azure, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, and Docker for cloud infrastructure and deployment
* Angular, TypeScript, and ASP.NET MVC/Razor for frontend and server-side rendering



  





 While the role is backend-focused, you’ll occasionally interact with the frontend and infrastructure layers.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in backend development using .NET and cloud technologies, ideally 5+ years. You are passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and robust solutions. You enjoy collaborating, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a learning culture. Staying curious and keeping up with modern development practices comes naturally to you.
 



  





**We offer** 




 We offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where innovation is truly encouraged. With a hybrid work model (three days in the office and two remote), you’ll have the flexibility to balance work and life. We also provide great opportunities for career growth, including access to training and professional development. Plus, you’ll get to work with a modern tech stack on exciting challenges in the banking industry.
 



  





**Sound interesting?** 




 We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. Please note that a valid work permit for Sweden is required for this position.
 



  





**Please note that this recruitment is managed by our external partner Safemind.
 *All* 
 applications are therefore submitted via Safemind's application form.**

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
emagine is looking for a
 **Senior .NET developer** 
 to help design, build, and scale a complex, high-performance cloud platform serving a global user base. You’ll work in a collaborative, agile team, tackling challenging problems in distributed systems and shaping the future of a large-scale service.
   

  

**Start** 
 : 2026-01-12
   

  

**Duration: 6 month** 
 (high possibility for extension)
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm. 2-3 days onsite at the office is needed
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build & Scale: Develop and maintain C#/.NET services running on Kubernetes in AWS.
* Own Your Work: Take full responsibility from design and testing to deployment and production reliability.
* Improve Continuously: Promote best practices in architecture, code quality, testing, and automation.
* Collaborate: Partner with engineers and product teams to solve complex technical challenges.


**What You Bring**
* Strong professional experience with backend systems in C# and .NET Core.
* Solid understanding of cloud-native architecture and CI/CD pipelines.
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
**Backendutvecklare – .NET & Optimizely CMS** 




  





**Plats:** 
 Stockholm (Hybridarbete – 2-3 dagar per vecka på kontoret)
 



**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  





 En etablerad aktör inom digitala lösningar söker nu en erfaren backendutvecklare till sitt utvecklingsteam. Rollen innebär arbete med moderna webbplattformar för organisationer med höga krav på kvalitet, tillgänglighet och säkerhet. Projekt finns både inom den privata och offentliga sektorn.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla och vidareutveckla lösningar i Optimizely CMS
* Delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen – från behovsanalys och arkitektur till implementation
* Samarbeta med projektledare, UX-designers och kunder i tvärfunktionella team
* Bidra till tekniska beslut och mentorera andra utvecklare
* Säkerställa att lösningarna uppfyller krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och prestanda



  





**Önskad kunskap:** 



* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET
* Djup kompetens inom Optimizely CMS och relaterade produkter
* God förståelse för C# och integrationer med externa system
* Erfarenhet av frontendutveckling (HTML, CSS, JavaScript – gärna React eller Next.js)
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar, gärna Optimizely DXP eller Azure
* Konsultativ förmåga och stark förståelse för kundens behov
* Intresse för tekniskt ledarskap och kunskapsdelning



  





**Vi erbjuder dig:** 



* Lön: 50 000 - 62 000 SEK + (beroende på erfarenhet) + förmåner
* Ett kompetent och engagerat team med god sammanhållning
* Möjlighet att arbeta med välkända kunder inom offentlig och privat sektor
* Kompetensutveckling och certifieringar inom Optimizely och relaterade teknologier
* En värderingsstyrd organisation med fokus på samarbete, kunskapsdelning och arbetsglädje



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Är du intresserad av att veta mer? Skicka gärna din ansökan eller kontakta mig direkt. Alla ansökningar hanteras konfidentiellt.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM** 




 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
 



  





 Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
 



  





 Together, we build the future of SAM.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As our Senior Frontend Developer at Xensam in Stockholm, you will work hands-on and become a proactive technical leader with a strong drive to solve complex problems. You’ll contribute across the entire product portfolio and support the team by providing technical guidance and stepping in wherever your expertise is needed.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will design, develop, debug, test, and enhance high-quality frontend features and integrations using JavaScript and TypeScript. You will collaborate closely with UX Designers, Product Owners, backend, and database developers to deliver great user experiences and ensure accessibility. Furthermore you will:
 


* Take ownership of the technical direction for frontend development, drive architectural decisions, and act as the go-to person for technical guidance during planning, estimation, and reviews.
* Guide the technical execution of projects, ensuring alignment with product goals, scalability requirements, and timely delivery.
* Ensure best practices across development, including CI/CD pipelines, code structure, testing strategies, and maintain high standards for code quality and performance.
* Apply modern security best practices and OWASP guidelines across all development activities.
* Promote engineering excellence by reviewing peers’ work, providing constructive feedback, enforcing best practices, and mentor junior developers.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 5+ years of experience in frontend development, including debugging, testing, and optimizing modern web applications.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript, with deep experience in React and state management libraries such as MobX.
* Solid understanding of frontend architecture, asynchronous programming patterns, and REST API integration.
* Proficient in Git or similar version control systems, and experienced with utility-first CSS frameworks like Tailwind.
* Strong knowledge of secure coding, authentication protocols (OIDC, JWT), and error handling.
* Good understanding of relational databases and frontend-backend interaction.
* Familiar with Agile methodologies and working in Agile/Scrum teams.
* Experience mentoring, reviewing code, and upholding high standards.
* Comfortable leading technical discussions, architectural decisions, and owning frontend initiatives.
* Good communication skills and a strong proficiency in written and spoken English.
* Preferably a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.



  





**Bonus Points If You** 



* Have a full-stack background, working across both frontend and backend development.



  





**What You Get** 



* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.



  





**Our values at Xensam** 




**Rebellious** 




 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
 



**Humane** 




 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmony** 




 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
 



  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Creative Developers
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.*
 We love creating great code that matters - and the people who write it. We are always on the look-out for coders skilled in C++ or C# with innovative mindset.
   

  

 If you want to use your coding expertise and problem-solving mindset to make the world more transparent, safer, and more democratic? At MSAB, you can turn that ambition into reality.
   

  

 We’re a global leader in digital forensics, building advanced tools used worldwide to solve crimes, fight corruption, investigate fraud, and support justice. Here, your code has real-world impact.
   

  

**Possibilities**
 As a developer at MSAB, you’ll dive deep into complex and highly technical challenges - exactly the kind that motivate curious, inventive engineers.
   

  

**Your Work Might Involve**
* Extracting and decrypting data from mobile devices
* Writing decoders, parsers, and low-level implementations
* Reverse-engineering apps and making complex data structures readable
* Implementing efficient, high-performance code in C++
* Working close to hardware, embedded systems, Android, or iOS internals


 If that excites you - you’re exactly who we want to meet.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 Our culture is friendly, supportive, and built on shared learning and technical curiosity. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy autonomy, like exploring new ideas, and want to grow by stepping outside your comfort zone.
   

  

 There’s much more to tell you about our tech stack, vision, innovation and ways of working, and the opportunities ahead. But let’s save that for future conversations.
   

  

 Ready to build software that makes a real difference?
   

  

 Send your application today.
   

  

 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
   

  

 What we can offer
   

  

 Create a safer world with us!
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
   

  

 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
   

  

 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
   

  

 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge?
   

  

 Department Development Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Java Developer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Hos oss på Capgemini får du inte bara jobba med Java – du får forma framtiden. Vi ligger i framkant när det gäller Generative AI, Data Engineering och skalbara molnplattformar. Våra projekt ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas inom cutting-edge teknologier som Java, Spring, AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, OpenShift, Kafka, GraphQL, React, Angular och Android. På vårt Stockholmskontor trivs vi i rymliga, ljusa lokaler med daglig frukost, nybryggt kaffe och en fantastisk utsikt över kanalen vid Barnhusbron.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att:
   

  

* Arbeta som Java Developer i spännande konsultuppdrag tillsammans med ett supporterande team omkring dig.
* Främja samarbete, proaktiv problemlösning och högkvalitativ leverans av Java-baserad programvara.
* Utnyttja din erfarenhet av Java, Spring och relaterade teknologier för att designa och utveckla robusta, skalbara och effektiva backend-system.
* Handleda andra utvecklare, genomföra kodgranskningar och driva bästa praxis.


 Din profil
   

  

* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, GCP eller Azure är meriterande
* Kunskap inom Data Pipeline, Data Visualization eller Generative AI är ett stort plus


 Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön, förmånliga tjänstepensioner och kollektivavtal som ger trygghet, samt fokus på din hälsa och ditt välmående, med initiativ för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid.
* En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus, samt ett brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för generativ AI och data engineering.
* En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt, samt möjligheter till internationella karriärer och ett fantastiskt nätverk av 340,000 kollegor globalt


 Ansökan
   

  

 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i karriären? Vi kan knappt vänta på att få höra från dig! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är det dig vi letar efter? Vi ser fram emot att ses!
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Game Client Framework Developer
description:
Hacksaw Studios are looking for experienced developers to work with our framework for developing casino game clients. We are a relatively young company, but has quickly grown to be a top developer of casino-style games for the iGaming industry. Remote is possible, but we prefer if you are based in EU.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a framework developer you will work together with the game development teams to deliver features and tools that they need, as well as doing maintenance, bugfixes and performance or usability improvements on existing code. You need to be able to consider all the aspects of implementing a feature, how it affects long term developer productivity and/or memory, GPU and CPU performance. The framework team also handle for example CI pipelines, e2e tests and client integrations, and depending on your skills or interests there are plenty of different technologies to explore.
   

  

 There are very few meetings and a lot of freedom and responsibility to prioritize and specify scope of work, so a great opportunity if you are good at communicating to find the right solution, but also like to be productive and have time to focus on individual tasks.
   

  

**Relevant Experience/Skills**
* Worked with different game development frameworks and some understanding of how they handle structuring of code and rendering of graphics and sound. Ideally with games targeting web for deployment.
* Experience with developing modules and API's to be used by other developers.
* We use Haxe as a programming language for the game clients, but the role does not require previous experience. Haxe should be familiar and quick to learn if you have experience with any C-like language like C#, Java, C++, ActionScript, JS or TS, but if you only have experience with for example OCAML, Haskell or Clojure we would still like to hear from you.
* Our tech stack includes git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab and AWS. Familiarity with any of those tools are beneficial but not required.

title: FUNCTIONAL DEVELOPER WITHIN VEHICLE CONTROL SYSTEMS
description:
**Working as Functional Developer**
 By working closely with your agile, cross-functional team, you will be involved throughout the entire software development cycle — from initial ideas and requirements to implementation, test automation, and functional vehicle tests. Your work will have a direct impact on the comfort and performance experienced by our customers.
   

  

 The Suspension Control team is responsible for the development of air suspension software. As a junior member of the team, you will participate in all phases of software development, including writing function specifications and requirements, coding in C or Matlab/Simulink, and developing test automation scripts in Python.
   

  

**Responsibilites:**
* Write and refine functional specifications and software requirements
* Develop software components in C and Matlab/Simulink
* Create and maintain automated tests using Python
* Participate in testing and investigations on test rigs and vehicles
* Collaborate closely within an agile, cross-functional team to continuously improve our products and processes
* Rotate tasks to broaden knowledge and support team success.


**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at our customers.
   

  

 You will be coached by a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of. We often invite our consultants to group activities such as lectures, after works and lunch meetings.
   

  

**Desired qualifications:**
 As a person you are curious, eager to learn, and proactive in taking initiative. Your attitude, mindset, and personality are just as important to us as your technical skills. You enjoy working in a team environment where you share both challenges and successes. With a solid technical understanding, you feel comfortable with software development, while also being interested in seeing the full picture and not afraid to tinker with physical hardware.
   

  

* You hold a B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in embedded systems, mechatronics, computer science, electronics, or a related field
* You have a solid technical understanding and feel comfortable with software development
* A background in mechatronics or controls is a plus.


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter
 **Kristofer Hedlund at kristofer.hedlund@nexergroup.com.**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
**Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here**
 .

title: Seeburger Specialist
description:
SEEBURGER BIS Platform Developer
 



  





 We are seeking a skilled and motivated Seeburger BIS Platform Developer to join our team. The primary responsibility of this role is to support the migration from current solution to Seeburger BIS Platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background and experience in SEEBURGER implementation projects, including: Requirements gathering, Solution design, Development and testing, Deployment and post-go-live support.
 



  





 Qualifications:
 



 Proven hands-on experience with the installation, configuration, administration, and troubleshooting of the SEEBURGER Business Integration Suite (BIS) in enterprise environments. Successfully supported customers in establishing secure SFTP connections to SEEBURGER, ensuring compliance with internal and external security policies.
 



  





 Technical Skills:
 



 • Proficient in implementing and managing a wide range of secure and non-secure protocols critical for B2B and Managed File Transfer (MFT).
 



 • Experienced in setting up secure communication channels using SSL/TLS, including certificate management and encryption standards to ensure data confidentiality and integrity.
 



 • Experienced in leveraging the SEEBURGER API to translate integration and communication artifacts into Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
 



 • Proficient in: XML, XSLT, JSON transformation logic
 



 • Strong understanding of SEEBURGER API capabilities for exporting operational metrics and perform

title: Senior C++ Developer
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

 We are seeking
 **Senior C++ Software Engineers** 
 to help us drive our strategic vision transforming the trading landscape for our clients globally.
   

  

 Our associates embrace change, easily integrate, and succeed in a fast-paced global environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in the design, development and testing of financial markets software products
* Developing and integrating different ways of information visualization
* Evolve technically while working on data-intensive latency-sensitive products
* Provide and receive constant technical feedback via well-established code-review practices
* Ensure internal quality standards are met through automated testing (e.g. unit, integration, performance, and throughput tests, etc.)
* Learn and improve your expertise in financial assets, investment banking, and financial technology
* Contribute and promote best practices in our development cycles using continuous integration.


**Profile Needed**
**Mandatory:**
* A bachelor’s degree from a recognized college or university in STEM, such as math, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.
* Over 8 years of C++ development experience in С++
* Solid knowledge of C++ features and programming techniques
* Comprehensive knowledge of basic algorithms and data structures
* Good understanding of modern C++ standards (C++ 17/20)
* Experience in debugging and troubleshooting
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a global team
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an attention to detail
* Familiar with applying OOP concepts in environments with challenging performance demands
* Good communication skills with an effective level of English proficiency


**Beneficial:**
* Knowledge of financial markets and financial technologies
* Linux/Unix experience on advanced user or admin level
* Experience in multi-threaded programming
* Experience in low-latency software design, performance profiling and optimization
* Knowledge of Internet protocol suite and network programming
* Knowledge of the LLVM toolchain
* Understanding of functional programming concepts
* Experience in other programming languages (Java, Python, Shell scripting, Rust, Haskell, etc.)


**About Us**
 Broadridge Trading & Connectivity Solutions (BTCS) products and services power high-performance multi-asset trading automating the entire front office for investment banks and brokers. BTCS services cover all aspects of agency and principal risk trading, client connectivity services, Middle-Office and post-trade matching. Assets supported include Equities, FX, Derivatives. crypto and ETFs across all global markets.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.
   

  

**Use of AI in Hiring**
 As part of the recruiting process, Broadridge may use technology, including artificial intelligence (AI)-based tools, to help review and evaluate applications. These tools are used only to support our recruiters and hiring managers, and all employment decisions include human review to ensure fairness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable laws. Please note that honesty and transparency are critical to our hiring process. Any attempt to falsify, misrepresent, or disguise information in an application, resume, assessment, or interview will result in disqualification from consideration.

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* A benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Help us redefine what it means to be a financial partner for everyday heroes**
 Sambla Group has already helped over 1 million customers take control of their finances. Today we are entering a new chapter. Our ambition is to move beyond loan brokerage and become a trusted personal finance partner. That means supporting customers across more aspects of their financial lives, building app-first experiences, exploring new ventures, and focusing on lasting relationships rather than one-off transactions.
   

  

 We are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 who wants to be part of this journey. This role is about enabling teams to build products that matter, fostering technical excellence, and helping engineers grow. You will work closely with Product to align priorities, ensure healthy delivery, and maintain the long-term technical health of systems and teams.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead and support a cross-functional engineering team, ensuring clarity, alignment, and focus
* Partner with the Product Manager to prioritize work, plan increments, and balance delivery speed with long-term system health
* Ensure high standards in software design, architecture, developer experience, testing, security, and operational reliability
* Establish and track meaningful engineering and product metrics that drive continuous improvement
* Coach and mentor engineers, support career growth, and foster a culture of learning, ownership, and collaboration
* Promote modern engineering practices including CI/CD, observability, and secure coding
* Collaborate with stakeholders across Security, Architecture, Compliance, Data, and Design to deliver safe and high-quality products in a regulated environment
* Help evolve how we work: ways of working, technical patterns, and team processes


**What We Are Looking For**
* We’re looking for someone with a solid background in software engineering who has also taken on leadership responsibilities, such as serving as an Engineering Manager or Tech Lead
* Solid understanding of modern engineering practices and system architecture
* Experience working in product-oriented teams with iterative development and frequent releases in a highly regulated sector
* Ability to build strong partnerships with Product Managers and cross-functional stakeholders, and raise the bar for ways for working within the team and department
* Comfortable using data and metrics to run experiments, guide decisions and measure outcomes
* Passion for coaching, developing people, and fostering a supportive team environment and a dynamic Engineering Culture in the department
* Experience in our technologies: TypeScript, Node.js, React, Next.js, AWS (including CDK and CloudFormation)
* You lead with clarity, calmness, empathy, and accountability
* Experience or understanding of IT governance frameworks, the agile manifesto, and regulatory standards such as DORA or GDPR is considered a bonus


**Why this role?**
* Lead with impact: guide a team that ships products used by thousands of customers
* Shape how we work: help define engineering practices and quality standards at an important stage in Sambla’s evolution
* Grow and develop people: play a key role in coaching and supporting engineers as they progress in their careers
* Work in partnership: collaborate closely with Product to create clear priorities and predictable, meaningful delivery
* Work with purpose: what you enable helps everyday people improve their financial lives


**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 400 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in all markets.

title: Client integration developer
description:
Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games, offering both social gaming and real money modes. Our games are played by millions of people every month worldwide. To support our growing technical ecosystem, we are looking for a Client Integration Developer to join our team in Stockholm.
   

  

 This role focuses on integrating our games with third-party platforms, ensuring seamless experiences for our partners. You’ll be part of a small but growing platform team responsible for client-side integrations and various products in our stack, including back-office systems, internal tools, in-game UI components, and more.
   

  

 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

* Manage client-side integrations of our games with various external platforms.
* Develop and maintain integrations using Haxe (our primary client-side language).
* Provide technical expertise around our integration framework.
* Debug and resolve integration issues, working closely with both developers and the QA teams.
* Collaborate with back-end teams to align integration strategies with our broader platform architecture.


**What We're Looking For**
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript or a similar language (experience with Haxe is a plus but not required).
* Strong understanding of web technologies, including browser APIs, and cross-origin communication (e.g., postMessage, CORS, WebSockets).
* Experience integrating web applications with third-party services.
* Ability to debug and troubleshoot integration issues, using browser DevTools and API testing tools like Postman.
* Strong communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to both developers and non-technical stakeholders.
* Service-minded and proactive, with a structured approach to problem-solving.
* Our tech stack also includes git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab and AWS. Familiarity with any of those tools are beneficial but not required.


 If you're a developer with strong web integration experience and a background in JavaScript/TypeScript (or similar languages), we’d like to hear from you.

title: Senior IT Developer (Opens in new window)
description:
Senior IT Developer
   

  

 Stockholm, SE, 111 46
   

  

**Job ID: 30404**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for an Senior IT Developer on full-time employment agreement.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the MDM Tech Software Development. Our role is to build the bridge between business processes, data management and customer master data systems, focusing on simplification and compliance.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities In This Role**
* Design and implement IBM InfoSphere MDM solutions (both Physical and Virtual MDM models) and BPM/BAW UI.
* Customize and extend MDM functionalities using MDM Workbench, Java & XML.
* Develop and deploy MDM services & business rules.
* Implement data stewardship, survivorship rules, match-merge logic and hierarchy management.
* Integration & Data Management.
* Integrate MDM with upstream/downstream systems using SOAP/REST APIs, MQ, or Kafka.
* Collaborate with ETL teams (e.g. IBM DataStage, Informatica, or Talend) for data synchronization.
* Provide technical guidance and code reviews to junior developers.
* Optimize MDM performance, troubleshoot production issues and manage upgrades/patches.
* Participate in solution architecture discussions and propose best practices for data quality & scalability.
* Work closely with data architects, business analysts and QA teams to deliver robust MDM solutions.
* Prepare technical documentation including design documents, test cases and deployment guides.


**Technical Skills**
* Core MDM Expertise:
+ IBM InfoSphere MDM (v11.x or later).
+ MDM Workbench, MDM Server, BAW / BPM.
+ Suspect processing, Task management, Match/Merge, Data Stewardship.
+ Java/J2EE, XML, XSD, XSLT.
+ REST/SOAP Web Services.
+ IBM MQ, Kafka, or similar messaging frameworks.
+ Oracle, DB2, or SQL Server.
+ Integration with DataStage or equivalent ETL tools.
+ Eclipse, RAD (Rational Application Developer).
+ IBM WebSphere Application Server.
+ Jenkins, Git, JIRA, Maven.


**Who You Are**
**Your background and skills include:**
* 5+ years working experience designing and developing IBM MDM Development.
* Preferred experience working with Java, PLSQL, CSS, SQL.
* Good competency in Java Webservices with advanced Excel skills.
* Sound understanding of master core data management concepts.


**It Would Be Ideal If You Also Have**
* Experience in analysis.
* Experience in Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development.
* Experience in SAFe.


**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**People** 
 are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 01/12/2025.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: Dynamics 365 and Power Platform Solution Developer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From configuration to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Would you like to leverage cutting edge Dynamics 365 and Copilot functionality and bring CRM to the next level in the bank? Then join us!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Dynamics 365 and Power Platform solution developer you will be part of distributed international team advancing Dynamics 365 CRM, Power Platform and Copilot for Sales. By using strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach you will be addressing challenges and increasing client-facing teams productivity and efficiency in Corporate, Investment Banking (CIB) at SEB. You’ll be implementing enterprise-grade solutions while having the freedom to experiment with and adopt the latest Microsoft platform features.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience with Dynamics 365 skills (Sales, Marketing, and/or Customer Service) as both a Functional Consultant and Developer/Configurator with proven track record of delivering end-to-end enterprise-level solutions.
* Experience in designing and implementing complex Power Platform solutions at scale
* Practical experience with Copilot for Sales or other AI-driven solutions, hands-on implementation is a strong advantage
* Strong communication skills, fluent and efficient in both business and technical environments.
* A positive attitude and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment, comfortable switching between strategic and detailed levels
* Fluency in English.


**What We Offer**
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Access to SEB staff banking and exclusive benefits.
* A prestigious team with experienced colleagues who value cooperation and openness.
* A workplace where we care about the work-life balance.
* An innovative company at the forefront of technology


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued. We are looking forward to your application by
 **November 30th, 2025** 
 . Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application before the deadline.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact Algirdas Rimkūnas, at algirdas.rimkunas@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: https://www.seb.lt/en/gs
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Salesforce Technical Specialist
description:
**Role:** 
 Salesforce Technical Specialist
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 15-20 years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Summary:** 




  





 The Salesforce Technical Specialist will be responsible for architecting, implementing, and supporting Salesforce-based digital transformation programs across industries including Telecom, retail, consumer goods, distribution, travel, hospitality, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, and Financial Services in the Nordic region. The role requires deep expertise in Salesforce Core Cloud Platforms (Sales, Service) and advanced customization using Apex/Lightning, and strong integration skills with enterprise systems. The candidate will be expected to lead solution design, ensure delivery excellence, and collaborate closely with business and IT stakeholders to drive measurable outcomes.
 



  





**Required Experience** 




  




* 8–12 years of total IT experience in Salesforce ecosystem and overall, 15-20 years of experience
* Proven track record in architecting and implementing Salesforce solutions for enterprise-scale clients.
* Expertise in Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Integration (REST/SOAP, Mulesoft), and CI/CD (Copado/Jenkins).
* Hands-on experience in Agile delivery and DevOps environments.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills with Nordic or European client exposure.



  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





  





**Portfolio Management** 




  




* Manage a portfolio of Salesforce transformation engagements across multiple Nordic clients.
* Ensure all programs align with enterprise architecture standards, scalability, and best practices.
* Track delivery health, risks, and dependencies across multiple initiatives.



  





**Solutions and Relationship Management** 




  




* Lead technical solutioning during RFPs and client workshops; define architectures, prototypes, and demos.
* Engage with C-level stakeholders to identify business pain points and translate them into scalable Salesforce solutions.
* Support pre-sales with estimation, solution documentation, and proposal development.



  





  





**Delivery Governance** 




  




* Drive high-quality delivery through technical governance, design reviews, and performance audits.
* Mentor and guide offshore/nearshore teams to maintain consistency in development and configuration practices.
* Ensure compliance with security, GDPR, and integration standards specific to the Nordic markets.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or related discipline.
* Salesforce Certified Application Architect or System Architect (mandatory).
* Additional certifications (e.g., Platform Developer II, Integration Architect, Industries CPQ Specialist-desirable)



  





  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Java-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* 5+års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling i Java
* Gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling av desktopapplikationer
* Gedigen erfarenhet av dataanalys eller signalbehandling
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat och leverera lösningar av hög kvalitet
* God samarbetsförmåga och kommunikation på både svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling inom komplexa system
* Erfarenhet av utveckling för komplexa tekniska plattformar eller realtidsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av integration mot hårdvarunära system


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Pedagogisk utvecklare
description:
**Vill du komplettera vårt lag och bidra till kompetensutveckling som gör skillnad i Försvarsmakten? Brinner du för lärande och utbildning som skapar god effekt i organisationen? Har du erfarenhet av att driva pedagogisk utveckling inom lärande? Då kan du vara den vi söker!**
**Om enheten**
 På Managementenheten (ManE) vid Militärhögskolan Karlberg utvecklar och genomför vi utbildning inom förvaltning och management. Vi bedriver både klassrumsförlagt och nätbaserat lärande. Våra målgrupper är främst chefer och specialister inom Försvarsmakten. Vi erbjuder dig en unik arbetsplats i slottsmiljö tillsammans med utmärkta förutsättningar till träning på arbetstid. Du kommer till en enhet bestående av kreativa och erfarna kollegor som verkligen trivs tillsammans.
   

  

 Managementenheten består av tre avdelningar som planerar och genomför kurser inom olika ämnesområden. Rollen som pedagogisk utvecklare är placerad på avdelningen för enhetsstöd och samverkar över hela enheten.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som pedagogisk utvecklare hos oss driver du utvecklingen av nätbaserade och klassrumsförlagda utbildningar samt blandade upplägg. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Stödja enheten i arbetet med att öka andelen blandat lärande i våra utbildningar
* Stödja kurschefer i att ta fram kursplaner och utbildningsinnehåll i enlighet med Försvarsmaktens utbildningsprocess
* Leda och genomföra kompetensutvecklingsinsatser inom pedagogik, blandat lärande och digitala produktioner
* Omvärldsbevaka och driva utvecklingsprojekt inom pedagogik och digitalt lärande
* Stödja enheten i framtagande av riktlinjer, rutinbeskrivningar och utbildningsmaterial
* Representera ManE i relevanta nätverk och arbetsgrupper


 Försvarsmakten växer och arbetsuppgifterna kan komma att utvecklas över tid.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom tex pedagogik, IKT, eller annat ämne som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdigt
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att ta fram utbildningar uppbyggda på blandat lärande
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att initiera, leda och genomföra utvecklingsprojekt inom utbildning
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som har ett stort driv inom utveckling av utbildning och som naturligt tar initiativ och driver arbetet framåt på ett handlingskraftigt och strukturerat sätt. Då du ska stödja enheten med pedagogisk utveckling är det viktigt att du är prestigelös samt samarbetar effektivt med andra. Du kommer att ha många kontaktytor, inom alla nivåer i Försvarsmakten och med andra aktörer vilket gör att du är kommunikativ, pedagogisk, konstruktiv och en positiv problemlösare. Du drivs av att motivera och skapa engagemang samt är van att ta stort ansvar samt självständigt driva utvecklingsprojekt från idé och behov till resultat och effekt i verksamheten.
   

  

 Tack vare ditt strategiska tänk och din anpassningsförmåga kan du identifiera och hantera förändringar i en dynamisk och snabbt föränderlig utbildningsmiljö och växande Försvarsmakt. Du är kreativ, analytisk och nytänkande, vilket hjälper dig att utveckla innovativa lösningar som möter skiftande behov inom utbildningsområdet.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram kursplaner och utbildningsinnehåll med utgångspunkt i pedagogiska teorier och taxonomier
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla digitala utbildningar, antingen som producent eller beställare
* Erfarenhet av att använda digitala verktyg som stödjer lärande, exempelvis AI, lärplattformar (LMS) och kommunikationsverktyg
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom Försvarsmaktens utbildningsprocess
* Gedigen kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med vuxnas lärande


**Övrigt**
 Anställningsform: Civil tillsvidareanställning, heltid. Sex månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten
   

  

 Arbetsort: Solna
   

  

 Tillträdesdatum: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Tjänsteresor förekommer
   

  

**Upplysningar om befattningen**
 Kan ställas till rekryterande chef: Ulrika Navier – ulrika.navier@mil.se, tel: 072-972 45 67
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Carla Vila Verde Vidén, SACO-S
   

  

 Stefan Ragnebrink, OFR/S
   

  

 Patrick Nääs, OFR/O
   

  

 Monika Danielsson, SEKO
   

  

 Samtliga nås via MHS Karlbergs växel: 010-82 390 00.
   

  

**Ansökan**
**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-12-15. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV och ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning samt svar på angivna urvalsfrågor.** 
**Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan!**
 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Vid Militärhögskolan Karlberg genomförs den grundläggande treåriga officersutbildningen tillsammans med Försvarshögskolan. Vid skolan finns dessutom Managementenheten, Veterancentrum, Försvarsmaktens enhet för Idrott och Fysisk prestationsförmåga, Lokalplaneringsenhet Mitt och Skolenheten. Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: .NET-utvecklare – FinTech
description:
FinTech-sektorn utvecklas snabbt, och vi söker nu en erfaren .NET-utvecklare som vill vara med och skapa framtidens finansiella lösningar.
 



  





 Företaget har den finansiella styrkan hos en etablerad enterprise-organisation men drivs fortfarande med den entreprenöriella känslan från starten. De har haft en stabil och lönsam tillväxt på över 20 % per år i mer än 20 år.
 



  





  





 Företaget har två huvudteam som utvecklar olika delar av affären:
 


* Edge Teams – Fokuserar på att utveckla nya funktioner (greenfield-utveckling) och underhålla befintliga system i mindre utsträckning.
* Core Teams – Arbetar med den centrala funktionaliteten i produkten, som till största delen är greenfield-utveckling.



  





 Alla team använder samma teknologistack med vissa mindre variationer, vilket gör det enkelt att byta mellan team och utforska olika tekniska miljöer. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas, rotera mellan team och arbeta med olika delar av produkten.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Har minst 5+ års erfarenhet som .NET-utvecklare
* Har erfarenhet av .NET, C# och ASP.NET Core Web API
* Har erfarenhet/intresse av Domain-Driven Design (DDD) och mikrotjänster
* Har erfarenhet av Azure och DevOps
* Har erfarenhet från finansbranschen – säkerhet är särskilt meriterande
* Är pragmatisk i din utvecklingsapproach och kan prioritera uppgifter i en miljö med mycket nyutveckling och oklara krav
* Har goda kommunikationsfärdigheter och kan förklara tekniska lösningar för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Har erfarenhet av SCRUM och eventuellt haft SCRUM Master-ansvar
* Kunskap inom frontend är ett plus men inget krav



  





 Här får du stora karriärmöjligheter med chansen att rotera mellan olika team och på sikt utvecklas till en Tech Lead-roll. Arbetsmiljön kombinerar det bästa av två världar – den strukturella tryggheten hos ett etablerat företag med den innovativa och dynamiska kulturen från en startup. Dessutom erbjuds en social och engagerande arbetsmiljö där teamet regelbundet anordnar både roliga och sportiga aktiviteter.Är du intresserad?
 



  





 Kontakta Therese Dahl idag på +46 8 502 425 51eller t.dahl@nigelfrank.com för mer information.

title: Utvecklare i C++ till stridsflygplan
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*
 Vill du vara med och utveckla avancerad teknologi som skyddar våra piloter i stridsflygplan och stärker Sveriges försvarsförmåga? Vi söker en
 **C++-utvecklare med minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet** 
 till en roll där du får arbeta med högteknologiska radarsensorer och system som gör verklig skillnad för både samhället och individen.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som C++-utvecklare blir du en viktig del av utvecklingen av radarvarnarsystem för stridsflygplan – system som identifierar och analyserar hot i realtid och ger piloter avgörande beslutsstöd. Du ingår i ett team av engagerade ingenjörer som arbetar med hårdvarunära programmering och inbyggda system. Rollen innebär stora tekniska utmaningar och möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och testa C++-kod för inbyggda system
* Optimera kod för prestanda och tillförlitlighet
* Felsöka, analysera och lösa komplexa problem
* Bidra till kodgranskning och kvalitetsförbättringar
* Samarbeta i ett agilt team och bidra till innovativa lösningar


**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som vill kombinera tekniskt djup med samhällsnytta. Du är analytisk, nyfiken och trivs med att lösa avancerade problem i nära samarbete med andra.
   

  

**Du har:**
* Examen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektronik eller motsvarande
* God erfarenhet av C++-utveckling
* Vana av hårdvarunära programmering och inbyggda system
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du även har:**
* Kunskap inom signalbehandling eller radarsystem


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
**Vi söker en engagerad integrationsutvecklare**
 Vill du arbeta med integrationer i teknikens framkant och skapa lösningar som förenar affärskritiska system och tjänster? Brinner du för att hitta enkla vägar till komplexa mål genom robust kod och moderna plattformar? Då vill vi träffa dig!
   

  

**Om rollen inom integrationsutveckling**
 Som integrationsutvecklare kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förvalta integrationer mellan olika system, applikationer och dataplattformar. Din vardag kommer att präglas av samarbete i tvärfunktionella team och du är med och möjliggör smidig dataöverföring, automatiserade flöden och skalbara processer. Rollen innebär att arbeta med både moln- och on-premise-lösningar, där du bidrar till att stärka våra kunders digitala ekosystem.
   

  

**Primära arbetsuppgifter – integrationslösningar och systemintegration**
* Utveckla, underhålla och optimera integrationer mellan interna och externa system
* Bygga och vidareutveckla API:er och middleware-tjänster
* Automatisera dataflöden och processer mellan affärssystem och dataplattformar
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare, arkitekter och verksamhetsrepresentanter för att säkerställa effektiva integrationslösningar
* Delta i kravställning och lösningsdesign tillsammans med verksamheten
* Kvalitetssäkra och dokumentera integrationsflöden och tekniska arkitekturer


**Krav och kvalifikationer för integrationsutvecklare**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av systemintegration och utveckling, samt förmåga att omsätta verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling
* Goda kunskaper inom C#, .NET och Phyton
* Erfarenhet av integrationsplattformar såsom Azure Integration Services, inklusive Logic Apps, API Management, Event Grid och Service Bus
* Kunskap om REST/SOAP-API:er och datamodellering (XML, JSON etc.)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (Azure, AWS), containerteknologier, kubernetes samt CI/CD-processer
* Förståelse för DevOps-principer


**Såhär är det att arbeta hos oss som integrationsutvecklare**
* En hybrid arbetsplats med flexibilitet och balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och certifieringar
* Frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka såväl din arbetsdag som våra arbetssätt
* Tydligt fokus på innovation, kvalitet och säkerhet i alla projekt
* Stark teamkänsla med kollegor som gärna delar med sig av kunskap
* Modern teknikstack och spännande kunder i flera branscher


**Vi Erbjuder**
 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
   

  

 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
   

  

 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
   

  

 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
   

  

 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
   

  

 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
   

  

 👩🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
   

  

 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
   

  

 🏌️‍♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Plattformsutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Många års erfarenhet av Kafka – både drift och utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av molnmigrering, gärna från on-prem till Confluent Cloud (eller annan molnleverantör).
* God förståelse för distribuerade system, event streaming och data pipelines.
* Tidigare bakgrund som Java-utvecklare, gärna inom fintech eller annan reglerad bransch.
* Förmåga att bidra både strategiskt och hands-on.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, DevOps och Kubernetes.
* Tidigare arbete i komplexa miljöer med höga krav på driftsäkerhet och prestanda.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
