 At ABAX, we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment for all our colleagues. This commitment also extends to ensuring our recruitment routines and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us and contribute to strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.

title: Operativ Inköpare
description:
Vi söker en Operativ Inköpare som vill vara med och säkerställa ett effektivt och stabilt materialflöde i en dynamisk och internationell miljö. Här får du en bred roll med stora möjligheter att påverka arbetssätt och bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar. Vill du arbeta nära både leverantörer och interna funktioner och samtidigt utvecklas inom inköpsområdet? Då kan detta vara rätt nästa steg för dig.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN:** 




 I rollen som Operativ Inköpare får kandidaten möjlighet att arbeta med ett helhetsansvar för materialplanering och säkerställa att lagernivåer, ledtider och distributionsparametrar är korrekta och optimerade. Tjänsten innebär att driva och utveckla det operativa flödet så att det harmonierar med interna riktlinjer och lagerpolicy. Det är en bred och dynamisk roll där man får möjlighet att påverka arbetssätt, bidra till förbättringar och vara delaktig i att skapa effektiva strukturer. Rollen erbjuds i en internationell och inkluderande miljö, där mångfald och samarbete ses som en stor tillgång.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** 



* Optimera materialinköp genom att arbeta med parametrar som säkerhetslager, prognoser och orderkvantiteter.
* Hantera orderläggning, ordererkännanden och uppföljning.
* Arbeta proaktivt med leverantörer för att hantera och förebygga avvikelser och materialbrister.
* Samarbeta nära andra funktioner, såsom strategisk inköp, produktion och R&D, i frågor kopplade till leverantörer och materialflöden.
* Driva förbättringsarbete inom inköpsfunktionen med fokus på att effektivisera arbetsmetoder och processer.



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM HAR:** 



* En kandidatexamen inom relevant område.
* Ett par års erfarenhet från en liknande roll inom inköp och/eller logistik.
* Stort tekniskt intresse.



  





 Som person ser vi att du är flexibel och trivs i en miljö där förutsättningar kan förändras snabbt. Du arbetar strukturerat och har en förmåga att skapa ordning och tydlighet i komplexa flöden. Din affärsmässighet gör att du kan fatta välgrundade beslut, och med ett starkt problemlösningsfokus tar du dig an utmaningar på ett analytiskt och proaktivt sätt.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du efter 6-12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 



* Omfattning: Heltid
* Start: Omgående
* Placering: Stockholm
* Lön: Marknadsmässig



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Senior Engineering Manager / Project Manager, Solutions for Industry (S4I)
description:
**Job Description**
**Senior Engineering Manager / Project Manager, Solutions for Industry (S4I)**
**DK, Germany, Sweden**
 Are you excited about leading the energy transition? Are you motivated by growing an international and diversified team? Are you a strong leadership profile?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, or you’re curious to learn more, then this role could be the perfect opportunity. Join our Solutions for Industry Department, and work with us to close the gap to a sustainable future.
   

  

**Your new role**
 As an Engineering Manager / Project Manager, you will be responsible for leading and overseeing a project team to ensure that our projects are delivered efficiently and successfully. You will coordinate and support technical development, monitor project progress and ensure that the teams meet their goals. You will also work closely with clients, stakeholders, and other internal teams to develop sustainable and innovative solutions that support the energy transition and help close the gap between the current state and the desired future state of sustainable development. S4Is main focus is plant engineering for hydrogen / efuel projects, chemical process industry and decarbonization projects.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities will be:**
* Management and leadership:
+ Management of a team of engineers and technical specialists. Promoting a collaborative and productive work environment. Conducting regular team meetings and individual performance reviews

* Project management:
+ Planning, scheduling, coordination and monitoring of technical projects. Ensuring that projects are completed within the given timeframe and budget. Manage resources and priorities according to project requirements in close collaboration with our PMO team

* Technical expertise:
+ Provide technical guidance and guidance to the team. Support in solving complex technical problems. Ensuring the quality and reliability of technical products and solutions

* Communication:
+ Reporting to the management on the progress and results of the projects. Coordinate with other departments and external partners to meet project requirements. Presentation of technical concepts and project results to stakeholders

* Budget management:
+ Development and management of the budget plan for technical projects. Monitoring the financial aspects of project work


**About You**
 For this Senior Engineering Manager / Project Manager position you ideally have:
   

  

  

* University degree in engineering or related field
* Proven experience in a leadership role in a technical field, ideally gained in chemical industry, Oil & Gas, power plant business or similar
* Generalist cross-discipline knowledge required
* Solid experience and in-depth knowledge of your technical discipline (e.g. process, electrical, civil, I&C); ideally gained in chemical industry, Oil & Gas, power plant business or similar
* Project experience from study phase to commissioning and start-up
* Excellent communication and leadership skills
* Ability to analyze complex technical problems and develop creative solutions in complex project environments
* Experience with budget management and resource planning and scheduling (Primavera P6, MS Project)
* Business fluent in English


 On top of these values:
   

  

  

* Be a visionary leader: Communicate a compelling vision for the Global Service Line to inspire alignment and commitment across global teams
* Innovative in thinking: Champion innovative approaches and integrate cutting-edge methodologies to advance the Global Service Line’s expertise and impact
* A Collaborative partner: Build strong relationships with Energy teams across Geographies to align strategies and ensure seamless service delivery
* A Client-focused strategist: Prioritize client outcomes by ensuring the Global Service Line delivers high-value, tailored solutions that address global needs


**What We Can Offer You**
* Leaders guided by our Leadership Principles
* A culture that welcomes you as the unique person you are
* Inspiration from colleagues, clients, and projects
* The long-term thinking of a foundation-owned company
* Permanent employment; of course, we are open to part-time models
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working
* Flat hierarchies and fast decision-making processes
* Extensive opportunities for further training and development
* Modern, ergonomic workplaces


**Ready to join us?**
 Apply online via our application tool. Please upload a cover letter, your CV, salary requirements and all relevant documents. Please let us know your earliest possible start date and your preferred office location. We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 Deadline:
 **30.11.2025**
**Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion**
 Equality, diversity, and inclusion are at the heart of what we do. At Ramboll, we believe that diversity is a strength and that different experiences and perspectives are essential to creating truly sustainable societies. We are committed to providing an inclusive and supportive work environment where everyone is able to flourish and reach their potential. We also know how important it is to achieve the right balance of where, when, and how much you work. At Ramboll, we offer flexibility as part of our positive and inclusive approach to work. We invite applications from candidates of all backgrounds and characteristics. Please let us know if there are any changes we could make to the application process to make it more comfortable for you. You can contact us at job.advert.accessibility@ramboll.com with such requests.

title: Backend Developer - Kotlin Developer
description:
We are seeking a skilled Fullstack Kotlin/React Developer to join our Logistics and Warehouse team, supporting the steel manufacturing industry. This is an exciting opportunity for a consultant who thrives in a fast-moving environment, where we are building processes and systems from the ground up.
   

  

 Main Responsibilities:
   

  

* Develop new features by building RESTful APIs using Kotlin Spring Boot microservices.
* Work within a microservices architecture, ensuring scalability and performance.
* Contribute to frontend development using microfrontends in React.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to design and map out business processes that shape IT system development.
* Engage in business architecture, helping to define workflows in a complex and evolving logistics environment.


 Key Requirements:
   

  

* Strong Kotlin development skills and experience working with Spring Boot microservices.
* Strong React development skills and experience working with microfrontends is a plus.
* Understanding of RESTful API design, cloud services, and modern software development best practices.
* Ability to navigate ambiguity, think critically, and contribute to business-oriented solutions.
* Experience in tech towards logistics, warehouse management, or steel manufacturing is a plus.
* Passion for working in a startup-like environment, where adaptability and problem-solving are key.


 We value individuals who combine technical expertise with a strong business sense. As we establish new processes and navigate uncharted territory, we’re looking for a consultant who is proactive, adaptable, and excited about making a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Other Details:**
**Start date:** 
 2025-11-25
   

  

**End date:** 
 2026-04-30
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm 3 days onsite.

title: Process Engineer | Epitaxy
description:
**Job Description**
 I denna roll kommer du att leda och förbättra avancerade produktionsprocesser som är avgörande för nästa generations optoelektroniska komponenter.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Processägarskap: Säkerställ robusta och effektiva tillverkningsprocesser som stödjer både produktion och produktutveckling.
* Processkontroll: Övervaka processer för att säkerställa stabilitet, repeterbarhet och jämn kvalitet. Använd SPC och datadrivna metoder för att upptäcka avvikelser och driva kontinuerliga förbättringar.
* Operativt stöd: Ta fram tydliga instruktioner och rutiner för den dagliga driften; utbilda och handleda operatörer och tekniker.
* Processkvalificering: Leda kvalificering av nya processer och utrustningar genom testplaner, utvärderingar och inline-analyser.
* Kontinuerlig förbättring: Initiera och leda förbättringsinitiativ inom produktionen.
* Dokumentation & rapportering: Ta fram tekniska rapporter, instruktioner och dokumentation som stödjer tillverkning, processutveckling och beslutsfattande.


**Utbildning och erfarenhet**
* Civilingenjörsexamen inom teknisk fysik, elektroteknik, materialteknik, kemiteknik eller motsvarande.
* Kunskap om halvledartillverkning är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**Färdigheter**
* Proaktiv och ansvarstagande med ett strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Vass analytisk förmåga
* God kommunikationsförmåga
* Praktiskt lagd, du trivs med att "kavla upp ärmarna".


**Arbetsmiljö**
 Arbetet sker både i renrumsmiljö (Wafer Fab) och på kontor i Järfälla. Enstaka resor förekommer.
   

  

**Säkerhetskrav**
 Alla medarbetare förväntas följa företagets
 **EHS-regler** 
 (Environment, Health and Safety) samt Coherents globala standarder.
   

  

**Våra värderingar – ICARE**
 Som medarbetare på Coherent förväntas du efterleva våra värderingar i allt du gör:
   

  

* Integrity – Skapa en miljö byggd på förtroende
* Collaboration – Skapa innovation genom att dela idéer
* Accountability – Ta ansvar för både process och resultat
* Respect – Visa respekt och värdesätt alla människor
* Enthusiasm – Hitta mening och engagemang i arbetet


**Vi erbjuder**
* En dynamisk och internationell arbetsmiljö
* En stöttande och kollegial företagskultur
* Tekniska utmaningar kopplade till framtidens produkter
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och goda anställningsvillkor


**Rekryteringsprocess**
 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, och intervjuer kan komma att hållas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Observera att vi på grund av stort antal sökande inte alltid kan ge individuell återkoppling.
   

  

 Slutkandidater kommer att genomgå bakgrundskontroll samt alkohol- och drogtest i enlighet med Coherents policyer.
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Experienced Integration Developer (D365 F&O)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Experienced D365 Finance & Operations (F&O) Integration Developer, you’ll take on a hands-on technical role focused on leading, designing and implementing integration solutions within the Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O ecosystem. You’ll contribute to shaping our integration strategy, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture standards, and driving innovation through the adoption of modern Microsoft technologies.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Developing and managing integrations between Dynamics 365 F&O and third-party systems using Azure services, APIs, and other integration tools to ensure seamless data flow and system interoperability.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather business requirements and translating them into scalable technical designs, including customizations, integrations, and data migrations.
* Leading the development team in designing and implementing Dynamics 365 F&O solutions, ensuring adherence to best practices and high-quality standards.


**Your profile**
* At least 7 years of technical experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O or as a X++ developer with proven hands-on experience developing in X++
* Fluency in Swedish and strong verbal and written communication skills in English
* Experience in solution design with technical leadership experience and stakeholder collaboration
* Working experience from implementation and support projects
* A solid understanding of business processes and practices, with the ability to evaluate system gaps and recommend improvements
* An ability to turn functional requirements into technical designs previously involved in full life-cycle projects


*Note: You need to be based in Sweden and proficiency in Swedish to be considered for the role.*
**About**
**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness and with a strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Lösningsansvarig IT till Vasakronan
description:
Det här är rollen för dig som brinner för att leverera digitala lösningar som på ett effektivt, säkert och långsiktigt hållbart sätt skapar mervärde för både kund och verksamhet. Går du också i gång på att driva samverkan och vill jobba i skärningspunkten mellan IT och verksamhet med fokus på ekonomi skulle vi vilja påstå att vi har din drömroll.
 



  





 För dig som är ny för oss är vi ett fastighetsbolag- faktiskt Sveriges ledande. Och frågar du våra nya kollegor säger i princip alla samma sak. Det är lätt att börja på Vasakronan för vi är vänliga, tar oss tid och är extremt bjussiga med vår kunskap. Här kan du förvänta dig att bli del av en kultur som är öppen, vänlig och inkluderande. Att Vasakronans avkastning går till det allmänna pensionssystemet, och att du på så sätt bidrar till dagens och morgondagens pensioner hoppas vi också att du ser som ett stort plus. Läs gärna mer om Vasakronan här.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Lösningsansvarig IT är du beställaransvarig för Vasakronans IT-stöd med fokus på ERP, ekonomi och fastighetssystem. Du säkerställer att systemen möter verksamhetens behov, fungerar effektivt och utvecklas i linje med Vasakronans strategiska mål.
 



 Rollen innebär nära samarbete med kollegor inom IT, ekonomi, controlling och leverantörer. Du leder kravarbete och ansvarar för icke-funktionell kravställning samt förvaltnings- och utvecklingsplanering. Du driver våra IT-leveranser, synliggör konsekvenser av möjliga val och följer upp leverantörer för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och säkerhet. Dessutom arbetar du strategiskt för att vidareutveckla IT-stödet och säkerställa en kostnadseffektiv leverans.
 



**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av Vasakronans IT-lösningar inom området.
* Samordna krav och behov, översätta dessa till lösningar och agera beställare mot leverantörer.
* Planera och följa upp förvaltnings- och utvecklingsarbete, inklusive budget och kostnadsuppföljning.
* Driva strategisk utveckling och kontinuerlig förbättring av IT-stöd.



  





 Du rapporterar till Vasakronans IT-chef och utgår från vårt moderna och fina huvudkontor i Sergelhusen, mitt i Stockholm City.
 



  





**Utveckla och utvecklas med oss** 




 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av lösningsarbete inom IT, med fokus på ERP och masterdatasystem. Du har även vana av att leda utvecklings- och förvaltningsarbete, där du säkerställer att tekniska lösningar effektivt möter verksamhetens behov.
 



  





 För bästa förutsättningar för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 


* Akademisk utbildning inom IT (systemvetare, ingenjör eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-stöd inom ERP, ekonomisystem eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltningsledning och/eller utvecklingsledning.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av upphandlingar och kravställning inom IT-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att driva strukturerad utveckling enligt en utvecklingmodell, t.ex. SAFe, Scrum eller liknande§
* Grundläggande förståelse för informations- och IT-säkerhet
* Grundläggande förståelse för IT-drift, ITIL, infrastruktur och nätverk
* Vana att driva icke-funktionell kravställning



 Meriterande är erfarenhet från fastighetsbranschen.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som är lösningsorienterad, strukturerad, analytisk och ser helheten utan att tappa fokus på detaljer. Viktigt är också att du är kommunikativ, initiativtagande och trivs med att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt. Du är även van vid att driva projekt framåt och tar ett stort ansvar för att skapa effektiva och användarvänliga lösningar. Då du kommer ha många kontaktytor internt och externt är det slutligen viktigt att du är en skicklig relationsskapare och inte bara gillar att samarbeta och dela kunskap, utan har en vilja att göra det – på absolut bästa sätt.
 



  





 Självklart kommer vi göra allt för att du ska lyckas, och här på Vasakronan finns alla möjligheter för ett hållbart arbetsliv och att driva din egen utveckling. Via vår kultur, olika utbildningar men framför allt genom att delta i eller leda spännande projekt tillsammans med våra engagerade och kompetenta kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sina erfarenheter. Här är det du som sätter gränser för din utveckling!
 



  





**Välkommen till Vasakronan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Boxhill Rekrytering. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningar löpande. Vill du veta mer, kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare Petra Törnblom på petra.tornblom@bhill.se.

title: Regional Compliance Counsel
description:
**About Us** 




**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**The role** 




 We are seeking a Regional Legal Counsel or Regional Compliance Counsel to join our Regional Legal & Regulatory team, with a particular focus on the Swedish and Danish markets, and broader regional support as required.
 



 Reporting directly to the Regional Head of Legal and Regulatory, you will act as a key advisor to the business on implementing legal and regulatory frameworks, particularly in the areas of Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Duty of Care, in a way that is both commercially pragmatic and operationally effective.
 



 This is a strategic, business-facing role where you will proactively support our regional operations by translating complex regulatory requirements into practical guidance, fostering a culture of compliance and integrity, and contributing to the development of robust internal processes and controls.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Provide expert legal and regulatory advice, particularly on AML and Duty of Care obligations, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
* Monitor, interpret, and communicate regulatory developments and their potential impact on the business and its operations.
* Take a leading role in industry and trade organizations, helping to represent and raise awareness of FDJ UNITED's position and priorities.
* Promote a strong compliance culture across the organization through effective communication, training, and stakeholder engagement.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to strengthen risk management strategies and ensure alignment with business objectives.
* Oversee and enhance administrative and reporting processes within the compliance function to improve efficiency and consistency.
* Conduct compliance risk assessments, identify areas for improvement, and propose effective mitigation strategies.



 Compliance obligations:
 


* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.



  





**How will success be measured in this role** 



* Acting in line with FDJ UNITED values
* Successful completion of all relevant training and other compliance activities that support FDJ's sustainable and responsible growth



  





**Your experience** 



* Master's degree in law (LL.M) or equivalent legal qualification, with strong knowledge of Swedish law and relevant EU directives.
* Minimum 6 years' experience in regulatory compliance or legal advisory roles — ideally within the banking, fintech, or regulated gaming industries.
* Proven ability to translate legal and regulatory requirements into practical business and operational processes.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
* Naturally curious, commercially minded, and hands-on, with the ability to navigate ambiguity and evolving regulatory landscapes within a regional context.



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Senior Digital Designer (Web Focus)
description:
***Relocation to Cyprus is mandatory***




  





 At Exness, we are not just a leading trading broker—we’ve reimagined what it takes to be a leader. With 40M+ trades a day and 2,000+ people across 13 countries, we combine scale, care, and real tech to make trading better for 1M+ clients worldwide.
 



 Recognised globally as a Best Place to Work, we’re a people-first company where long-term wins always matter more. As part of our team, you will shape the future of fintech with real technology, care, and purpose.
 



  





**Why this role matters** 




 At
 **Exness** 
 , we’re repowering our
 **in-house agency-level creative team** 
 . We’re looking for a
 **seasoned Senior Digital Designer** 
 with a proven track record in
 **UX/UI design** 
 for major brands. You’ll bring a sharp eye for
 **website experiences, landing pages** 
 , Customer Journey and a portfolio that proves you can make complex journeys seamless, engaging, and commercially impactful, at the same time you will also focus on impactful graphical elements for the websites and other projects. Agency + in-house experience is a must; fintech is a plus.
 



 You’ll elevate Exness.com and other Exness websites into best-in-class digital products, where design isn’t just aesthetics but a driver of business growth and customer trust.
 



  





**What you'll actually do** 



* Own the
 **end-to-end UX/UI design** 
 of websites, landing pages, and non-product app flows.
* Partner with product, dev, and marketing to
 **optimize user journeys** 
 for conversion and retention.
* Work with
 **design systems and develop scalable templates** 
 to unify brand experience.
* Conduct
 **competitor audits and trend analysis** 
 to keep our platforms ahead of the curve.
* Prototype and test designs, using
 **data-driven insights** 
 to refine solutions.
* Collaborate with copywriters, motion designers, and performance marketers on integrated campaigns.



  





**Who we’re looking for** 



* 5+ years of
 **UX/UI experience** 
 for international brands (agency + in-house mix).
* Strong
 **portfolio of web/app projects** 
 with proven business results.
* Mastery of
 **Figma, prototyping tools, and Adobe Creative Suite** 
 .
* Understanding of
 **CRO principles** 
 and A/B testing.
* Confident communicator with ability to present to
 **senior stakeholders** 
 .
* Knowledge of
 **fintech UX** 
 or regulated industries is a plus.



  





**What we offer along the way** 



* Competitive salary and annual performance bonus
* Full relocation support for you and your family — flights, housing, visas, and legal assistance included
* Top-tier health insurance with full family coverage — medical, dental, vision, mental health — plus life insurance for peace of mind
* Unlimited learning opportunities: external courses, English lessons, career and leadership development
* Education allowance covering school and kindergarten fees
* 21 working days of annual leave, plus public holidays and fully paid sick, maternity, and paternity leave
* Employee appreciation program: branded gifts, birthday day-offs, celebration budgets for weddings, newborns, and milestones
* “Get to know Team” trips — meet colleagues across our global hubs, along with company-wide offsites that raise the bar
* Employee share scheme — grow with us
* Branded MINI Cooper Countryman company car and private parking
* Free in-house sports clubs, Sanctum Club gym access, and jet skis
* Access to a Corporate doctor
* Exclusive discount program with cafes, gyms, and local services
* Expat tax perks: up to 50% income tax exemption
* Support with the naturalisation process for relocated employees
* At Exness, we know that changing jobs - and changing countries - is a big step. That’s why relocation with Exness is different. We make it smooth, supported, and truly life-changing.



  





**What your journey looks like** 



1. Intro call with Recruiter (30 minutes)
2. HM Interview (60 minutes)
3. Test Task
4. Final interview (60 minutes)
5. English check (if needed)



  





 What it's like here
 



 Curious about what working at Exness really looks like? Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn.
 



 We share the real Exness experience - our people, ideas, moments, and everything in between.

title: Senior Pricing Manager
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Pricing Manager to drive the Instabee’s pricing agenda. In this position, you’ll set the direction for how we price and optimise our services across markets, working closely with sales, product, and strategy teams. The role goes far beyond crunching numbers – it’s about combining sharp analysis with business insight and problem-solving skills to turn pricing into a competitive edge.
   

  

 You’ll be right in the middle of some of the most important questions for our growth: finding the balance between profitability and volume, shaping how our checkout is optimised for different markets, and making sure pricing supports our long-term ambitions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and drive our pricing strategy, ensuring it strengthens both growth and profitability.
* Dig into data and trends – from cost structures and unit economics to consumer behaviour and competitor moves – and translate insights into concrete actions.
* Run complex pricing projects from analysis to execution, making sure initiatives are rolled out successfully across teams.
* Present clear, data-driven recommendations to senior leadership, turning analysis into decisions that move the business forward.


**About You**
 You are an analytical and curious problem-solver who enjoys making sense of complexity and turning it into clear, actionable insights. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, have the confidence to take ownership, and are motivated by tackling some of the toughest and most strategic questions in a growing business. With strong communication skills, you can present and “tell the story” behind the numbers, building trust and alignment with senior stakeholders.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Bring**
* Proven experience from roles involving financial modelling, forecasting, and data-driven decision making.
* A background in pricing, strategy, or management consulting, or other roles with similar analytical demands.
* Strong communication and presentation skills with fluency in English (written and spoken).
* Ability to work across functions and manage senior stakeholders in a collaborative way.
* An academic degree in Industrial Engineering, Finance, Economics, or similar, with advanced Excel/Sheets skills; BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI are a plus.


**What We Offer**
 At Instabee, you’ll get to work on one of the most strategically important areas of our business. As our Senior Pricing Manager, you will:
   

  

* Be responsible for a domain with direct impact on our competitiveness and profitability.
* Collaborate closely with senior leaders and contribute to key strategic decisions.
* Work in a dynamic scale-up where your analysis quickly turns into action.
* Join a team that’s reshaping last-mile delivery to be smarter, more sustainable, and more customer-friendly.

title: Data Analyst, Languages /Content (Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)**
**The Opportunity:**
 As a Data Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Product Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Product department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda. You will be instrumental in ensuring there is consistency in data being used for reporting, identifying value-added data to help the business grow as well as using data to make strategic business decisions. You will be expected to dig into data to provide business insights, guide decision-making and offer valuable inputs to further grow our business model.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Translate business briefs into structured analytical projects by clarifying objectives, defining key questions, and outlining deliverables.
* Analyze large-scale data sets to deliver clear, actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Conduct deep dives into customer behavior and language performance to identify growth opportunities and optimize user journeys.
* Support translation automation and MT / AI translation workflows
* Launch data-driven initiatives, develop dashboards, and automate processes for greater efficiency.
* Lead new analytics projects to streamline workflows, enhance reporting, and drive organizational efficiency.


**Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Math, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Economics).
* Proficient in SQL, Excel, and Python (Pandas, NumPy) for data analysis, transformation, and automation.
* Skilled in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Metabase) for building interactive dashboards.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking abilities; experienced in A/B testing and experimental analysis.
* Detail-oriented, with a focus on data accuracy and quality. - Able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; able to explain technical concepts to diverse audiences and collaborate across teams
