**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Senior Jira Administrator
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Jira Administrator** 
 to manage the Atlassian Jira Cloud at Canonical, including the administration, configuration, automation, and integration responsibilities. We expect the highest engineering quality, rigorous documentation practices, and effective stakeholder management abilities. Our goal is to enable Canonical engineering and business teams to leverage the power of Atlassian Jira, work on challenging assignments, and enable teams to make data-driven decisions.
   

  

 The role is in the Commercial Systems team that integrates business systems used at Canonical to ensure reliable data flows at the right time to the right place, and to automate business processes across the company. We own a wide range of systems including popular SaaS solutions, such as Jira, Salesforce, NetSuite, Greenhouse, GSuite, and a few dozen others. To achieve this goal, we leverage Python and Go in combination with open source tools, such as Airbyte and Temporal. Our work helps to make data-driven decisions, and increases the efficiency of business operations.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role can be held anywhere in EMEA time zones.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Manage Atlassian Jira Cloud at Canonical
* Design, document, and implement processes and automation in Jira
* Design, document, and implement integrations between Jira and the data warehouse
* Create analytical dashboards to enable stakeholders make data-driven decisions
* Create learning resources that scale
* Work with engineering, operations, and support teams at a global scale
* Take ownership of critical escalations and resolve them in a timely manner


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Experience with Atlassian Jira and its ecosystem as an administrator
* Understanding of common Jira usage patterns for various technical and non-technical departments
* Experience as a software developer in Python
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders, remain highly motivated, productive, and organized in a fully remote environment
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


**Nice-to-have skills**
* A perspective on process architecture
* Experience with complex cross-project automation


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* 8+ års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling i realtidskritiska och inbyggda system
* Stark kompetens inom algoritmer, kombinatorik, performance och profilering
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt samt av utveckling som inkluderar krav och test
* Goda kunskaper i något eller flera av följande språk: C, C++, Ada, Java eller C#
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat i komplexa systemmiljöer
* God kommunikationsförmåga och vana att samarbeta i tekniskt avancerade team
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från säkerhetsklassade systemmiljöer


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 05-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Systems Test Engineer
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced System Test Engineer eager to play a vital role in ensuring the quality of ARX, Scandinavia's leading Security System? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! Join our collaborative Development Team at ASSA ABLOY Opening Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What you would do as our System Test Engineer:**
 You would have the opportunity to work closely with various functions across our organization, including Product Owners, Marketing, Production, Quality, and Customer Support. This role also offers you the chance to deepen your expertise in the ARX Security System and contribute to its continued excellence. We value work-life balance as a foundation for sustained productivity and success.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Verify and validate complete systems, including Client/Server architecture, Distributed Control Units, Readers, and Motor-locks, while building and maintaining test systems.
* Write, execute, and automate tests, ensuring robust testing processes for both manual and automated workflows.
* Analyse requirements, trace faults, and diagnose issues, proposing corrective actions to ensure high quality and optimal performance.
* Document test coverage and defects, creating clear overviews to track progress and ensure thorough validation.
* Collaborate closely with other Testers and Software Developers to align testing processes and improve system reliability.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Proven experience in system testing and integration, with practical knowledge of testing embedded systems.
* Proficiency in Python, Robot Framework, and Linux, along with experience working in agile team environments.
* Familiarity with tools and technologies such as GitLab, Confluence, JIRA, and test automation frameworks like Jest, Playwright, or Cypress.
* A proactive mindset, strong initiative, excellent teamwork skills, and the ability to analyze and solve problems in a structured and methodical way.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


 Ideally you would have knowledge of Java, C, cybersecurity, and GUI testing.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be subject to background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Din roll
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.
   

  

 Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.
   

  

 Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
* Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
* Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
* Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
* Utveckling av REST API:er.
* Det är krav på svenska i tal och skrift samt svenskt medborgarskap.


 Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:
   

  

* Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
* Azure och Databricks.
* Python och gärna PySpark.


 Varför Knowit?
   

  

 På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.
   

  

 Låter detta som en roll för dig?
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: Integration Specialist to Sweco IT
description:
*Do you want to be part of shaping a sustainable future through innovative technology? At Sweco IT, we’re looking for a talented and driven Integration Specialist to join our team. You’ll be contributing to digital capabilities to support Sweco’s mission of transforming society sustainability.*
**The Role**
 As an Integration Specialist at Sweco IT, you’ll collaborate with a diverse team of IT professionals and project managers to design, develop, and implement software solutions. You will primarily maintain and develop integrations between Sweco's datawarehouse and other source databases. Major source databases are finance systems and HR systems hosted in different countries. On a normal day there are about 400 million rows imported to the datawarehouse.
   

  

 You need to have a basic understanding and experience of how integrations between systems are created, some integrations are file based, some db to db. You also need a basic understanding of how deltaloading can be applied to make sure the number of imported rows can be as low as possible. Learning the structure of the datawarehouse will be a huge part of your learning curve.
   

  

 You will belong to the Masterdata & Integration team. We are an agile team of 8 people who help the entire organization with data and integrations to various systems and applications.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Developing and maintaining integrations between business applications and a Masterdata datawarehouse
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements deliver innovative solutions.
* Participate in projects


**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you have/are
   

  

* Advanced knowledge of MS SQL language
* Knowledge about SSIS/ADF
* Knowledge of MS SQL databases
* Experience with Visual Studio
* Experience with DevOps
* Fluent in English
* Meritorious if you also have experience of C# and .NET platform
* Meritorious if you also have experience of the Azure platform


**About You**
 The successful candidates will have the following attributes
   

  

* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details
* You realize the importance of being open to new ideas and sharing your knowledge with your team
* You are curious, and want to know how and why things are done
* A proactive approach and ability to communicate efficiently with colleagues at all levels
* Always keen to constantly get better at what you do


**Why join Sweco?**
* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working.
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning.
* Flexible work with freedom and responsibility and a competitive compensation package.


**Can you see yourself as a part of Sweco?** 
 Then don’t hesitate to send us your application and CV via the link below. We will review applications ongoing, so make sure you apply as soon as possible and no later than 28th of December.
   

  

 We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact Us** 
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Fredrik Nilsson, manager for Masterdata & Integration, at fredrik.nilsson2@sweco.se.
   

  

 Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process.
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 23,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information,* 
*http //www.sweco.se*

title: Fullstack Engineer - Workspace Experience Team
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Mentimeter serves hundreds of millions of users with services we deploy roughly 40 times a week. With transaction loads up to hundreds of votes per second, we need to scale while delivering a fast and smooth experience.
   

  

 We work in small, independent, cross-functional teams. Each team's product manager works with the team to organize and plan the backlog, with a focus on continuously delivering value to our users.
   

  

 Please note that we are an English-first company, meaning you don't have to know Swedish to work here. Make sure your application and relevant documents are in English.
   

  

**About The Workspace Experience Team**
 You'll be joining our Workspace Experience team, where our mission is to enable users and organizations to gain compounding value from being part of a shared workspace. We're building systems that support workspace growth at every scale - from small teams with just a few licenses to enterprise organizations with thousands of users.
   

  

 Our team helps users unlock additional value from their shared organizational context and embeds Mentimeter deeper into their everyday work.
   

  

 Beyond coding, you'll help shape strategic decisions about workspaces and their capabilities. You'll develop deep insight into how organizations grow and what they need to manage Mentimeter effectively, from team collaboration patterns to enterprise-grade requirements.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As a fullstack engineer at Mentimeter, you'll be an integral part of a cross-functional product team, implementing user experiences that affect millions of people worldwide. You'll work with other engineers, a Product Manager, a Product Designer, and an Engineering Manager. Even though there are specific roles in the team, we solve problems together. We want someone who engages with the team in product and design decisions and doesn't shy away from discussions. This role is for someone who wants to do more than just write code 8 hours a day.
   

  

 Delivering value to our customers and users is essential, but an equally important task is helping other engineers scale and grow. To succeed in this role, you must enjoy mentoring others and be motivated by seeing them develop—not only as developers, but as product engineers driving the product forward. You should enjoy the entire product development chain: breaking down user problems into feasible work, writing and testing code, and ensuring it efficiently gets to production. This means a reasonable amount of context-switching will be expected during sprints.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 For this role, we're looking for at least 6 years of related work experience as a fullstack engineer with a strong understanding of product development. You most likely also have a master's degree in a relevant engineering field. Passion and expertise within backend engineering is a plus.
   

  

 You're a reliable, high-performing individual contributor with a solid understanding of your area of specialization. You have a good idea of what you want to do and then just do it. You embrace change and short feedback loops.
   

  

 We hope you bring a passion for software development, scalable architecture, and building great products. Code quality is important to us, so an interest in quality, testing, and automation is essential. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work both independently and in a team are other traits we look for in all our colleagues.
   

  

 Last but not least, you must have a curious mindset, be open to learning and sharing knowledge, and be interested in working with our tech stack.
   

  

**The technologies we use**
 Our Stack Consists Of a Frontend Written In React (Next.js And TypeScript), And a Backend Written In Ruby (not Rails), Supported By
   

  

* Tailwind CSS
* Redis
* PostgreSQL
* Cloudflare
* AWS


 We're looking for someone who is comfortable moving across the stack in both frontend and backend. If you know Ruby, that's great, but knowing another backend language well and being willing to learn Ruby is equally fine. It's more important to us that you have the right attitude than the exact right skill set.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process**
* Introduction TA interview: Get to know us better and introduce yourself further
* Culture interview: Discuss our company culture and core values
* Competence interview: Meet some colleagues and dive deeper into your background and knowledge


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* A benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Join Fifty and Shape the Future of Energy Optimization** 

  





**Location:** 

 Åre/Stockholm (Hybrid)
 




  






 Fifty is building the next generation of energy optimization technology. As markets shift, electrification accelerates, and flexibility becomes critical, we are developing an intelligent platform that helps businesses unlock the full value of their energy assets — batteries, EV charging, solar, heat pumps, and more.
 





 We are now looking for a Senior Backend Developer who wants to build high-impact systems, influence architecture, and be part of a fast-moving team pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in the energy space.
   





**What you will be working on**
* Building scalable backend services in Python that power our Multi-Market Optimization (MMO) engine.



  




* Developing cloud-native systems running on Kubernetes and TimescaleDB/Postgres.



  




* Designing and improving APIs used for forecasting, optimization, real-time control, and data ingestion.



  




* Working closely with data scientists, product, and platform engineers to ship features that matter.



  




* Taking ownership of architecture decisions and guiding the evolution of our core platform.



  




* Ensuring reliability, performance, and security as we scale.



  





  




**What we are looking for**
* Strong experience with Python in production-grade systems.



  




* Deep understanding of backend architecture, distributed systems, and API design.



  




* Experience with cloud environments (preferably Kubernetes-based).



  




* A structured, proactive way of working. You take responsibility and drive things forward.



  




* Curiosity, pragmatism, and a willingness to challenge assumptions.



  




* Experience in energy tech, optimization, forecasting, or numerical computing is a plus but not required.



  




**Why join Fifty?**
* Work on technology that contributes to a greener, more flexible energy system.



  




* Be part of a tight, ambitious engineering team where your voice matters.



  




* Freedom to influence architecture, tooling, and workflows.



  




* Build something from the ground up



  




* A culture of trust, ownership, and straightforward communication.



  




**Requirements**
* Valid work permit for Sweden or EU citizenship.



  




* Ability to work on-site regularly with the team (Åre or Stockholm).

title: Integrationsutvecklare
description:
**Vi söker en engagerad integrationsutvecklare**
 Vill du arbeta med integrationer i teknikens framkant och skapa lösningar som förenar affärskritiska system och tjänster? Brinner du för att hitta enkla vägar till komplexa mål genom robust kod och moderna plattformar? Då vill vi träffa dig!
   

  

**Om rollen inom integrationsutveckling**
 Som integrationsutvecklare kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utveckla och förvalta integrationer mellan olika system, applikationer och dataplattformar. Din vardag kommer att präglas av samarbete i tvärfunktionella team och du är med och möjliggör smidig dataöverföring, automatiserade flöden och skalbara processer. Rollen innebär att arbeta med både moln- och on-premise-lösningar, där du bidrar till att stärka våra kunders digitala ekosystem.
   

  

**Primära arbetsuppgifter – integrationslösningar och systemintegration**
* Utveckla, underhålla och optimera integrationer mellan interna och externa system
* Bygga och vidareutveckla API:er och middleware-tjänster
* Automatisera dataflöden och processer mellan affärssystem och dataplattformar
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklare, arkitekter och verksamhetsrepresentanter för att säkerställa effektiva integrationslösningar
* Delta i kravställning och lösningsdesign tillsammans med verksamheten
* Kvalitetssäkra och dokumentera integrationsflöden och tekniska arkitekturer


**Krav och kvalifikationer för integrationsutvecklare**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av systemintegration och utveckling, samt förmåga att omsätta verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
   

  

* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling
* Goda kunskaper inom C#, .NET och Phyton
* Erfarenhet av integrationsplattformar såsom Azure Integration Services, inklusive Logic Apps, API Management, Event Grid och Service Bus
* Kunskap om REST/SOAP-API:er och datamodellering (XML, JSON etc.)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (Azure, AWS), containerteknologier, kubernetes samt CI/CD-processer
* Förståelse för DevOps-principer


**Såhär är det att arbeta hos oss som integrationsutvecklare**
* En hybrid arbetsplats med flexibilitet och balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och certifieringar
* Frihet under ansvar och möjlighet att påverka såväl din arbetsdag som våra arbetssätt
* Tydligt fokus på innovation, kvalitet och säkerhet i alla projekt
* Stark teamkänsla med kollegor som gärna delar med sig av kunskap
* Modern teknikstack och spännande kunder i flera branscher


**Vi Erbjuder**
 🥪 En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
   

  

 🌍 Hybrid arbetsplats
   

  

 💑 Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
   

  

 🍏 Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
   

  

 🍰 Fredagsfika tillsammans
   

  

 🏡 Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
   

  

 ✔ Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 🙌 Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
   

  

 👩🏽‍🤝‍🧑🏼 Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig 💛
   

  

 🚗 Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
   

  

 🏌️‍♂️ Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**
**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**
 Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:
   

  

 Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total
   

  

 Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
   

  

 Tel: 070 -729 19 82

title: Client Platform Developer
description:
*Please note: This is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately, we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.*
**About Hacksaw Studios**
 Hacksaw Studios creates online games that run in both social and real-money modes, played by millions of people worldwide each month. To support our expanding technical landscape, we’re looking for a Client Platform Developer to join our Stockholm team.
   

  

 This position focuses on primarily client-side work—building and maintaining a range of web-based products and tools, from in-game UI and back-office systems to our round-replay system and integration frameworks. However, you may occasionally work on back-end tasks as well. You’ll be part of a small but growing team that spans multiple domains, ensuring our platform remains robust, scalable, and user-friendly for both internal teams and third-party partners.
   

  

 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

* Develop and Maintain: Work on core web-based products such as our in-game UI and back-office systems.
* Integration & Collaboration: Manage client-side integrations of our games with various external platforms and support third-party studios building on our OpenRGS platform. Collaborate with back-end teams to align integration strategies with our broader platform architecture.
* Tooling & Automation: Create and maintain help-tools (e.g., scripts for changelog generation, mock clients, game launchers) to optimize workflows across different departments.
* Technical Support: Provide expertise and troubleshooting for platform-related issues, working closely with developers, QA, and customer support teams.
* UX & Visual Detail: Contribute to user-friendly interfaces and ensure a polished look and feel for our products. A good understanding of UX and a keen eye for design are preferred.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript or a similar language. (Experience with Haxe, our main client-side language, is a plus but not mandatory.)
* Strong Understanding of Web Technologies: Familiarity with browser APIs, cross-origin communication (e.g., postMessage, CORS, WebSockets), and third-party service integrations.
* Debugging & Problem-Solving Skills: Experience using browser DevTools, Postman (or similar tools), and a structured approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Communication Skills: Ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Service-Minded & Proactive: Comfortable owning problems, driving solutions, and collaborating with diverse teams.


**Bonus Points**
* Experience with Git, TypeScript, Linux, bash, npm, Bun, Docker, Cucumber, GitLab, and AWS.
* Experience working with web-related C#.


 If you’re a skilled web developer with a passion for building and integrating we’d love to hear from you!

title: Development Engineer Test and Simulation - Senior Professional 1
description:
*Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.*
*Do you want to contribute to shaping Scania’s future product offering? Are you passionate about understanding the full vehicle and how technology is experienced from the driver's & owner’s perspective? Then this could be the right role for you!*
*Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.*

title: Mulesoft Integration Developer
description:
At
 **Schibsted** 
 , our mission is to empower people in the Nordics to make informed decisions through high-quality journalism and innovative digital solutions. Behind the scenes, our Integration Solutions team ensures that systems and services are seamlessly connected, enabling efficient workflows and operations across the organization.
   

  

 We are currently seeking an
 **Integration Developer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **MuleSoft Anypoint** 
 . Ideally, you also bring experience in platform and infrastructure management to support our growing
 **Integration Solutions team** 
 . If you're passionate about building scalable integration systems, automating infrastructure, and working in a collaborative, open-minded team, this could be your next exciting challenge.
   

  

 In this role, your main responsibility will be integration development within MuleSoft Anypoint platform. You will be a key member of the development team, as well as collaborate closely with the infrastructure team to manage the platform infrastructure, ensuring seamless system integration and robust infrastructure management.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
 The Integration Solutions team is playing a key role in building a future-ready integration landscape. We have established a new
 **Integration Competency Center (ICC)** 
 where you’ll be part of shaping the tools, processes, and infrastructure that support essential business operations across HR, Finance, Payroll, and more.
   

  

**What you’ll do**
 As an
 **Integration Developer** 
 you will:
   

  

* Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and secure integration solutions using Mulesoft.
* Monitor and maintain platform performance with proactive incident and environment management.
* Collaborate with both IT and business stakeholders to translate needs into practical, scalable solutions.
* Work closely with Solution Architects and Integration Architects to continuously evolve our integration platform.
* Actively contribute to a transparent, agile team environment, sharing responsibilities like the Scrum Master role.


**Who you are**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment and values honest collaboration. You might be a great match if you:
   

  

* Are passionate about technology and creating well-functioning, scalable integration solutions.
* Drive integrations from concept to production with a focus on automation, scalability, and continuous improvement.
* A strong communicator who can explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
* Are pragmatic, proactive, and always looking for opportunities to improve tools and processes.
* Enjoy working closely with others and helping build a collaborative team culture.
* Embrace feedback and continuous learning as part of your daily work.


**What you bring**
 We're looking for a strong mix of technical skills and collaborative mindset. Ideally, you have:
   

  

* Hands-on experience designing and implementing integration solutions using tools like MuleSoft, APIs, and event-driven messaging.
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools (like GitHub Actions) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform) is helpful, especially when collaborating with the infra team, but not essential.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for creating maintainable, high-quality solutions.
* The ability to work independently while contributing actively to an agile, team-driven environment.

title: Backend Engineer - Business systems expert
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Revenue Engineering** 
 team.
   

  

 The team is responsible for our core backend, subscription management and integrations to business support systems. You’ll work on a wide range of projects — from distributed systems and data pipelines to integrations with finance and CRM systems — in close collaboration with web developers, designers and business stakeholders.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design and develop backend services needed to realise our product roadmap
* Improve, evolve and replace existing services and APIs
* Ensure our systems remain performant, reliable and cost efficient
* Collaborate with finance and operations teams to translate requirements into technical solutions
* Help the team grow by sharing knowledge and lifting each other up


**About You**
 We believe that great engineers come from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

 You're someone who thrives in a collaborative environment, enjoying the process of solving problems as part of a team. With a curious and open mindset, you're always eager to learn, explore new ideas, and embrace challenges.
   

  

 You know how to prioritise and adapt in a fast-moving setting while keeping sight of the bigger picture. Open communication is important to you, and you feel comfortable both giving and receiving constructive feedback in a supportive and respectful way.
   

  

 You’re a backend engineer who enjoys bridging product, data and business systems. You take pride in writing reliable code, but also in understanding how your work impacts billing, reporting and real customers.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 3+ years of experience building backend services with Go and/or Scala, working with GraphQL and REST, and shipping data to or working with BigQuery
* 1+ years hands-on experience with NetSuite (configuration, data mapping or integrations using REST, SuiteTalk or SuiteScript)
* 1+ years of stakeholder collaboration with finance teams (internal ERP users) and operations/RevOps teams (internal CRM users)


**Beneficial Requirements**
* Experience integrating systems like Shopify, Adyen or other similar platforms
* Background in ERP or business systems development (as a consultant or internal developer)
* Interest in financial systems, billing, and subscription management
* Experience working in an international SaaS company


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Verification Engineer – MedTech
description:
Join Sii Sweden as a System Verification Engineer and take part in developing world-leading products in MedTech industry. In this role, you’ll work on complex, interdisciplinary challenges, from analysing requirements, designing and executing test specifications, and ensuring the quality of embedded systems. You’ll collaborate with a highly skilled R&D team to explore, test, and refine solutions that make a real difference in healthcare technology.
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Analyze requirements and design detailed test specifications
* Execute manual and automated tests to ensure system functionality and quality
* Conduct exploratory testing to identify potential defects
* Write and maintain automated test scripts
* Ensure proper traceability, validation, and documentation of all testing activities
* Collaborate closely with development and systems engineering teams



  





**Requirements** 



* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or equivalent
* At least 4 years of experience in the test and verification of embedded systems
* Experience with C++, Python, and Linux environments
* Analytical, systematic, and proactive approach to problem-solving
* Excellent communication and documentation skills in English and Swedish



  





**Nice-to-have requirements** 



* Safety-critical/healthcare systems, Squish, Qt

title: Testingenjör, Mjukvara - Robotic Milking
description:
**Testingenjör, Mjukvara – Robotic Milking**
 Vill du vara med och utveckla teknik som gör skillnad – för både människor och djur?
   

  

 DeLaval är den största utvecklaren, tillverkaren och leverantören av lösningar för mjölkproduktion globalt
   

  

 Vi söker nu mjukvarutestare till våra utvecklingsteam inom robotmjölkning – – i en miljö där teknik, hållbarhet och samarbete står i centrum.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som mjukvarutestare blir du en viktig del av avdelningen Robotic Milking, där vi utvecklar automatiska mjölkningssystem. Du ansvarar för testning inom ditt team – både automatiska och manuella tester och bidrar till att förbättra våra testmetoder och simuleringsverktyg.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära utvecklare och andra testare, och har många kontaktytor inom hela DeLaval. Vi tror på tvärfunktionellt samarbete och att olika perspektiv leder till bättre lösningar.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och förbättra testmiljöer med simulatorer och automatiska tester
* Delta i strategiarbete kring testmetoder och planering
* Samarbeta med utvecklare och testingenjörer för att samordna behov och idéer
* Granska krav och specifikationer ur ett testbarhetsperspektiv
* Samla in, visualisera och kommunicera testresultat
* Utföra tester på olika nivåer, dokumentera avvikelser och bidra till kvalitetsförbättringar


**Kvalifikationer**
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning.
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning
* Erfarenhet av att skapa automatiska testfall
* Kunskap i Java, C++, phyton eller C
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och/eller engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Stort intresse för testutveckling och teknik.
* Nyfiken, kommunikativ och gillar att samarbeta.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt, sätta kvalitetsmål och bidra med din kompetens till teamet.
* Tålamod och drivkraft – egenskaper som gör dig till en viktig del av DeLavals fortsatta framgång.


**Jobba på DeLaval**
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där mångfald ses som en styrka
* Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och karriärvägar
* Flexibla arbetssätt och balans mellan arbete och privatliv
* Ett meningsfullt arbete där du bidrar till hållbar mjölkproduktion
* Flexibla arbetstider och arbetstidsförkortning
* 30 dagars semester
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr/år
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Tjänstepension och arbetsrelaterad olycksfallsförsäkring


**Övrig information**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering vid DeLavals huvudkontor i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Rekryterande chef: Kattis Karttunen, kattis.karttunen@delaval.com
   

  

 Rekryterare: Agnes Edbom , agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**Om DeLaval**
 Vår vision är att göra hållbar livsmedelsproduktion möjlig.
   

  

 Som ett företag byggt på innovation arbetar vi ständigt med att hitta sätt att hjälpa våra kunder – mjölkbönder – att göra mer med mindre, genom att erbjuda världsledande mjölkningsutrustning och lösningar.
   

  

 Idag har DeLaval cirka 4 500 engagerade medarbetare som verkar i över 100 marknader världen över. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval-koncernen. Läs mer på corporate.delaval.com.

title: Senior IT Developer for Settlement (Opens in new window)
description:
Senior IT Developer for Settlement
   

  

 Stockholm, SE, 112 51
   

  

**Job ID: 30425**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Calypso Developer to join our team developing components powering one of core processes in the trading business - Settlement. This is a permanent and full-time position, based in our office in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Settlement Development team. Our role is to develop and modernize integrations of Calypso - our modern Settlement system with the rest of the bank’s IT landscape. Besides the 4 scrum teams developing the platform, there are a development support team and a maintenance team. This way the development teams can focus on delivering high quality solutions. Calypso is a central piece of Nordea’s trading lifecycle and supports settlement of bonds and equities. Our team’s main focus is on expanding business logic of Calypso and on surrounding microservices. Responsibilities for this position include both integrating vendor upgrades and enhancing functionality, specifically adding support of new flows. Currently, our Calypso installation is on the path of expanding scope to process settlement of bonds and equities in all Nordea markets.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities In This Role**
* Designing and coding robust, well-tested, clean solutions using latest tools and technology
* Developing in and around a complex off the shelf platform Calypso – creating code, which smoothly integrates with the Calypso engine
* Performing code reviews and work with developer colleagues in continuously improving quality and clean coding practices
* Closely collaborating with product owners, business experts, IT Analysts, Developers, testers and Scrum Masters and take an active part in agile ceremonies
* Participating in our technology communities - dev days, innovation sprints and day to day


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you are a skilled Calypso and Java developer with 6+ years of experience, are fluent in English and have good interpersonal skills in dealing with technical and business stakeholders. And you own problems whether you know the solution or not – if the latter, you are not afraid to ask questions and seek answers. Finally, you have a sense of humour and strive in multinational environment.
   

  

**Your Background And Skills Include**
* Knowledge and experience of Calypso platform, preferably supporting settlement of securities (bonds, equities)
* Understand how to define and design good test coverage including negative tests
* Practical experience in using some of tools and technologies below – or similar:
+ Docker, Kubernetes or OpenShift
+ Git, BitBucket, SonarQube, Splunk, Bamboo
+ Confluence, Jira

* Experience or desire to learn to build and maintain integrations with off-the-shelf software in the enterprise setup


 It would be ideal if you also have a degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**People** 
 are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 12/12/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Zbigniew Piotrowski at zbigniew.piotrowski@nordea.com.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: FUNCTIONAL DEVELOPER WITHIN VEHICLE CONTROL SYSTEMS
description:
**Working as Functional Developer**
 By working closely with your agile, cross-functional team, you will be involved throughout the entire software development cycle — from initial ideas and requirements to implementation, test automation, and functional vehicle tests. Your work will have a direct impact on the comfort and performance experienced by our customers.
   

  

 The Suspension Control team is responsible for the development of air suspension software. As a junior member of the team, you will participate in all phases of software development, including writing function specifications and requirements, coding in C or Matlab/Simulink, and developing test automation scripts in Python.
   

  

**Responsibilites:**
* Write and refine functional specifications and software requirements
* Develop software components in C and Matlab/Simulink
* Create and maintain automated tests using Python
* Participate in testing and investigations on test rigs and vehicles
* Collaborate closely within an agile, cross-functional team to continuously improve our products and processes
* Rotate tasks to broaden knowledge and support team success.


**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent specialize in giving young tech talents the ultimate start in their careers. For this role, you will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent but work at our customers.
   

  

 You will be coached by a consultant manager at Nexer Tech Talent. As a consultant, you will be well taken care of. We often invite our consultants to group activities such as lectures, after works and lunch meetings.
   

  

**Desired qualifications:**
 As a person you are curious, eager to learn, and proactive in taking initiative. Your attitude, mindset, and personality are just as important to us as your technical skills. You enjoy working in a team environment where you share both challenges and successes. With a solid technical understanding, you feel comfortable with software development, while also being interested in seeing the full picture and not afraid to tinker with physical hardware.
   

  

* You hold a B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in embedded systems, mechatronics, computer science, electronics, or a related field
* You have a solid technical understanding and feel comfortable with software development
* A background in mechatronics or controls is a plus.


**Application**
 Does this sound like you? We are constantly screening resumes, therefore please submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Tech Recruiter
 **Kristofer Hedlund at kristofer.hedlund@nexergroup.com.**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
**Nexer Tech Talent is part of the Nexer Group – a tech company with deep roots in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. Together, we are over 2500 employees in 15 countries who, for more than 35 years, have helped our clients stay ahead strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here**
 .

title: Utvecklare / Tech Lead till BI-teamet på SEK
description:
**Bygg datalager och analysverktyg som BI-utvecklare med fokus T-SQL, Python och Azure på Svensk Exportkredit!**
 Är du en fena på T-SQL för ETL-flöden som vill bidra, utmana och ta initiativ i en miljö där finans möter teknik? Som BI-utvecklare och Tech Lead på Svensk Exportkredit i Stockholm arbetar du över hela BI-flödet från ax till limpa, från Data Engineering till Data Analysis. De datalager och analysverktyg vi utvecklar levererar data och insikter som tar oss vidare på vår datadrivna resa! Vi ser ett ökat behov av analyslösningar och datadrivna beslut, vilket innebär att vi nu vidareutvecklar vårt datalager och rör oss mot mer moln- och Python-baserade lösningar. Här möter du humor, kompetens och samarbetsvilja – och devisen att alla frågor är bra frågor! Vi söker nu en person för att förstärka vårt team som varje dag arbetar med att möjliggöra SEK:s uppdrag.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En stark och tydlig verksamhetsvision – att hjälpa svenska företag att expandera produktion och försäljning över hela världen, samt att prioritera grön omställning
* Att utvecklas i din Tech Lead-roll och växa in i större ansvar i och för teamet, samtidigt som vår tekniska miljö förändras
* Ett starkt engagemang och snabba beslutsprocesser, där varje kollega spelar en viktig roll
* En roll där ditt engagemang och dina initiativ får gensvar, och din leverans gör skillnad


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Vi ansvarar för att förvalta, vidareutveckla och supportera lösningar för informationshantering, inklusive analys och rapportering, för SEK:s olika verksamhetsområden. Vi arbetar primärt i en Microsoft-miljö och använder T-SQL för ETL och datalagring, PowerBI och SSRS för rapporter samt OLAP- och Tabulär-kuber för vidare analys. För beräkningar och analys används även Python, och vi ser ett växande behov av att kombinera detta med molnbaserade lösningar i Azure. Så ser vår miljö ut – du behöver inte kunna alla områden, men vara beredd att lära dig.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter automation i så hög utsträckning som möjligt i utvecklingsprocessen, och det är endast i undantagsfall vi har manuell hantering av deployer idag. Kvalitet och spårbarhet är viktigt hos oss och vi använder GIT, Jira och Azure DevOps som våra huvudverktyg för att säkerställa det.
   

  

 Nästan all processning av data från affärssystemen sker nattetid och med hjälp av ett schemaläggningsverktyg (Universal Automation Center från Stonebranch). Varje utvecklingsteam ansvarar för vidareutveckling av sina respektive flöden.
   

  

**För Dig Innebär Det Att Du**
* Tar in och tolkar krav, där du rådger och bidrar med din expertis för att skapa en förståelse för verksamhetens behov, och den tekniska lösning som möter behovet på bästa sätt
* Utvecklar våra datalager, analysverktyg, databaslösningar och analys-kuber
* Som Tech Lead samarbeta med andra TL samt arkitekter i arkitekturfrågor, fördjupa dig inom ett eller flera verksamhetsområden och vara en förebild när det gäller best practices


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Team BI är en grupp om ca 15 kollegor, både konsulter och anställda, med kompetens som spänner brett. Inom teamet är vi uppdelade i fyra mindre grupper med varsin Tech Lead, som är inriktade mot var sitt verksamhetsområde. Vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med de andra utvecklingsteamen, med SEK:s säkerhets- och operationsteam samt med våra kollegor i verksamheten.
   

  

 Vårt kontor ligger på Fleminggatan 20 i Stockholm och vi träffas minst tre dagar i veckan på kontoret, men har i övrigt ett flexibelt arbetssätt och distansarbete när det passar uppgiften.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som arbetat med T-SQL i minst 5 år, som BI-utvecklare med fokus på ETL, eller som analytiker. Du arbetar idag inom, eller har tidigare erfarenhet av, bank- eller finansbranschen, och har gissningsvis börjat arbeta med Python som en del av din vardag. Azure DevOps och/eller kub-utveckling är meriterande.
   

  

 Du trivs i en roll där du får bidra med både helhetsperspektiv och känsla för detaljer. Du tar ansvar, driver utveckling framåt och delar med dig av idéer som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Du är bekväm med både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk.
   

  

 Som person och kollega drivs du av att lösa problem, ta initiativ och ha en överblick över både detaljerna och helheten. Du bidrar aktivt i diskussioner, vill och vågar ta ansvar och bygger förtroende. Samarbete, transparens och kommunikation är viktigt för oss, både som team och organisation, och vi söker dig som delar den inställningen – de bästa idéerna och lösningarna kommer vi fram till tillsammans.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Frostbite Master Thesis - AI Workflows
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA Sports and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Master's thesis student in our team, you will develop a project an area where Frostbite's engineering efficiency can be multiplied with generative AI, agents, or context engineering. You will also gain an understanding of what it's like to work at EA.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* You will investigate and prototype applying GenAI solutions to Frostbite's development process.
* You will review designs and implementations with other software engineers and will validate your results using a representative dataset.
* You will report to an engineering manager, attend meetings, present progress information and write a final report.


**Requirements**
* You are pursuing a MsC. in Computer Science, or a related field, in Sweden.
* You have experience with Python, C# or C++.
* You understand software development processes.
* You have an interest in applying GenAI to software engineering (e.g. GitHub CoPilot).


**Bonus but not mandatory**
* You have knowledge of AI concepts like knowledge graphs, vector databases, context engineering, MCP servers, LangChain, or RAG.
* You understand software quality, test automation, or CI/CD.


 This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Master Thesis Intern
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Master’s Thesis Internships – Computer Vision & Machine Learning at EA Sports TRACAB (Stockholm)
   

  

 EA Sports TRACAB’s Computer Vision and Machine Learning team is offering several exciting master’s thesis projects for 2026. We are a team of 24 researchers and developers based in Stockholm, applying advanced technology to sports analytics. Projects will run from mid-late January to July 2026.
   

  

**Available Project** 
**s**
* Human Mesh Recovery in Crowded Situations: Advance state-of-the-art human mesh recovery using multi-view sports footage, focusing on challenging crowded scenarios.
* Event Detection: Develop automated event detection models for football by aligning and utilizing player, ball, and event tracking data.
* Football Pitch Localization: Build a machine learning system to accurately detect and localize football pitch features in video footage.
* Creating a New SMPL Model Using Synthetic Data: Design and evaluate a new Skinned Multi-Person Linear (SMPL) model trained on synthetic human mesh data.
* Football Trajectory Modeling: Model and classify football flight dynamics using high-frequency tracking data.


 For more information about our team, visit the TRACAB Official Website.
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
